name: ORIGINAL Beautyblender Makeup Sponge
about: What it is:.A top-selling makeup sponge, the super-soft, exclusive, latex-free foam quickly blends makeup for an easy application and flawless, skin-like finish...What it does:.The unique shape and exclusive material available only with Beautyblender ensures impeccable, streak-free application with minimum product waste. Use it with foundations, powders, and any other complexion product...What else you need to know:.Made with the same exclusive ultra-plush foam as the original Beautyblender. When wet, it becomes mega soft and mimics pores to create a natural airbrushed application easily. Plus, it absorbs water, not makeup, so your fave formulas land on your skin, not in your sponge. Made in the USA...It is cruelty-free and formulated without latex, parabens, sulfates, and phthalates...This product is an Allure Best of Beauty winner....Allure
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Wet Beautyblender with water for each use...-Squeeze out excess liquid, using a towel if necessary...-Bounce foundation, bb cream, powder, or any other base and complexion product across the face for flawless results...-Cleanse with your favorite Blendercleanser formula after each use to remove makeup and grime...-Replace every three to six months upon signs of wear and tear.

reviews.review_title: Quality Gone Downhill, Do Not Buy!
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve bought beauty blender sponges for years upon years. I used them on not only myself but on all of my clients and recommended to everyone. Each one I bought lasted many years. Now in 2024 I bought a new one to replace one as my home had a mould problem and I had to toss many of my belongings. Now I wish I had kept the old one! This new one has ripped and has chunks coming out of it within the first use. Also pink dye pours out of the sponge with each wash which means that the dye seeping into my skin. Unacceptable and disappointing that beauty blender has deceived its loyal customers and changed their quality. I will never buy one again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Beautyblender has become an absolute staple in my makeup routine, and for good reason! Hereu2019s why Iu2019m giving it a glowing five-star review: Flawless Application: The Beautyblenderu2019s unique egg-shaped design ensures that my foundation, concealer, and blush go on seamlessly. No streaks, no harsh linesu2014just a natural, airbrushed finish. Texture and Elasticity: The latex-free sponge feels incredibly soft against my skin. When dampened, it expands to the perfect size, making it easy to blend makeup effortlessly. Plus, it retains its shape even after repeated use and cleaning. Celebrity-Approved: Meghan Markle, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner, and other A-listers swear by the Beautyblender. If itu2019s good enough for them, itu2019s good enough for me! Radiance Boost: Using a damp Beautyblender adds a subtle glow to my matte foundation. Itu2019s like having a built-in highlighter for my face. Versatility: While the original Beautyblender is fantastic, the brand has also created specific Blenders for blush, concealer, and body makeup. So whether youu2019re perfecting your base or adding a pop of color, thereu2019s a Beautyblender for every step.

I tend to do more natural looking makeup these days, so I love being able to blend that down with this sponge & get in the tighter corners around my nose & eyes with the pointier side. Overall, I get these as stocking stuffers every year for the girls in my life that wear makeup because it's such a staple product in my beauty routine. Always a hit! (gifted in exchange for honest review)

This iconic sponge ensures even coverage and effortless application, making it a must-have tool for makeup enthusiasts and professionals alike. Its versatility, durability, and ability to create a natural, radiant look solidify its place as an essential item in any makeup kit.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using the Beauty Blender sponge for years now. There is nothing like it for smooth blending of foundation. Even if I tried other companies versions, I always came back because none were better. Well that was then but now, the last 3 times I have purchased this Beauty Blender I have had the same experience other reviewers are reporting: pitting after just a few washes and what looks like stretch marks. I haven't gotten those black marks others have gotten (yuck!) but within a couple of months the sponge gets a sort of sweet rotting smell that makes me feel that the sponge was no longer something I wanted near my skin. I wash my sponge every single day and it used to be that the sponge would last for months. It is not an inexpensive sponge so I counted on this. Now, I will be more likely to switch to a cheaper brand because this is just not the product it once once.

reviews.review_text: I am reviewing this product as a personal and honest opinion for positive, negative, or neutral feedback. This is an Incentivized review on behalf of Influensters. I have seen over 1000's of both negative and positive reviews. I personally disagree with a few opinions others have shared. This product can be used best when the sponge is wet. This baby absorbs and I do mean absorbs water, but it does not absorb your makeup.   I have seen people complain and say the sponge developed mold in a matter of weeks. This is caused by no proper cleaning after use or left makeup on the sponge and not using certain products to clean any bacteria that may develop on the sponge after use.  I enjoyed every minute of using this sponge and yes I would spend $20 on a makeup sponge again. I spend $500-$600 on Xbox materials, and gear. I even spend money on small businesses' products, I do a bunch of giveaways when I stream on Twitch, so $20 is nothing at all.   The beauty blender absorbs water very well, and it gets about 3x its normal size. It feels very, very, soft, when it needs to be dried out, it does go back to its normal size as presented when you first bought it. And it feels very smooth to the touch and when applied.   I did use this with many different brands of makeup foundations, I also used the beauty blender foundation. The only issue with my foundation was I was given the wrong shade. Which is fine, I made it work anyway, which as result it did make me 2 shades darker than my natural skin tone. It does effectively blend so well with my skin and feels very lightweight and not caked on and thick.   I would use this foundation and the beauty blender again but make sure I get the right shade. I was very excited to try this product I am in the beginning stage of using makeup products and am used to experimenting with different brands, colors, thicknesses, thinness, long-lasting wear, etc. I do recommend using it if conducted properly and giving it more than a 1-time

reviews.review_title: Rocky nor raw eggs are The Champ. This is.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Hello. I'm a dinosaur that was used to buying Chanel brushes before the education of cruelty was made forthright in the cosmetics community. Then until Wayne Goss and some of the Asian best he followed presented brush-harvested and cruel-free I was stuck in a time-warp. With synthetics and aging skin. A lifetime of mostly acne-free oiliness did me some favors. Then I saw this pink thing. I thought it looked like junk. I was proud to refuse buying it. One day I bought a bad dupe. Then one day I read or saw something that intrigued me. I bought it. OMG!!! I am on my 3rd. The pink eggs are a miracle! I don't know if this tip will help anyone else; I always have a clean or with clean-sides left small towel dedicated for the BEAUTYBLENDER. I first wash it with a bit of any reasonable soap, gently, Then I squeeze and rinse. Then I twirl in clean under the faucet and let it get fat and absorb water. Then I give it a slight squeeze. Then it's still real wet and I light press it into the clean towel, so it is plink and full but not squeezing water out. Then I mix foundation or mix on outside of my hand. Then I use the Wayne Goss trick and add one dot of quality oil (Josie Maran Argan) and mix quickly and dot over half my face. Then I bounce and spread. Do the other half. Any left over is left for extra spots of coverage. Then concealer using the Beauty Blender again, then some powder. Then I gently squeeze and then towel squeeze the BB again and let it fully dry in a little holder I have. Sorry so long. It is a genius device. It needs to be holding water, but not too wet. And you must clean it before using again, but most important? Give it a little rinse at least, a gentle squeeze, and a towel squeeze with a clean towel. DO NOT put your foundation on it. You will love it!

reviews.review_text: I fell for some hype during the last sale and ordered this product. I've used imitations before and wasn't impressed. I can see why people like this...1) It feels good 2) very bouncy and light on the face 3) Does a good job applying makeup sheerly and can even be used for creamy blush & highlighter blending. So in terms of doing its job, it's great.  What I don't like:  It's wasteful. 1) There's a major drought where I live and this requires a lot of water to soak it and then wash it after every use. 2) I am using at least 4X more foundation than I normally do. When applying foundation with clean fingers, as I've done for 40 years, I use about two pea-size drops. With this, I'm using at least a quarter-size drop or more. 3) It's one more thing on my counter and requires buying makeup cleaner, drying it out, etc. Trying to decide if it's worth the drive to return it, but regardless, I won't buy another one.  Short version: This is a good product but just not right for me.

reviews.review_title: the bad reviews are due to incorrect use!!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The bad reviews and u201cmouldyu201d sponges, are most likely from incorrect use (using it dry, or swiping/pulling instead of bouncing it on the skin) and incorrect cleaning/storage causing moisture and bacteria to be trapped inside.   Makeup sponges in general, should be replaced every 3 months MAXIMUM, even sooner than that if you use it every single day. They should be left out to air dry fully before putting them in any sort of holder/storage.   I find it most effective to apply coverage with a brush, and perfect the finish with the beauty blender, but you can definitely use them to apply product as well.

reviews.review_text: My absolute favourite beauty blender. I have tried so many different sponges and although they are amazing, like the original Real techniques sponge or the ELF Total Face Sponge, nothing really compares to the original beauty blender - my other sponges do not grip loose translucent powder like the beauty blender does to bake, which is a letdown. The size of the beauty blender seems small but becomes much bigger when damp. It also lasts a great amount of time for me, like about a year, but I would typically change my beauty blender within the first 6 months as it could be unhygienic to keep it for longer (6 months might be a long time for some people too, but I use other sponges as well and clean them excessively). A lot of people say that this sponge is overhyped and overrated but it works really well for me, so personally, I would say it is worth the hype if you are willing to spend the money on a sponge. It makes my makeup application look so smooth and flawless, especially my under eyes!

I left it on a napkin to dry fully, and no pink dye came out at all during the drying process. I think that maybe some people are getting bad batches of the product, but regardless they should address it if itu2019s happening this often because thatu2019s not acceptable given itu2019s price. Performance wise I love this sponge, and I know Iu2019m going to reach for it often. It gives my skin this flawless airbrushed finish that I canu2019t get with other sponges. It doesnu2019t hold onto my product, and it blends seamlessly into my skin. Iu2019m really happy I decided to give it a chance.

reviews.review_text: I am so disappointed in this product! I hired a professional makeup artist for my wedding and she used a sponge that was so soft with amazing coverage. She let me keep the sponge and I used it for a little while until it was time for a replacement. I had no idea what brand it was so figured I couldnu2019t go wrong with the original. But I was so disappointed for a few reasons: 1) itu2019s super small and even when wet, it doesnu2019t expand much. 2) the coverage is really unimpressive versus the original sponge the makeup artist used and 3) when washing the makeup off the sponge using a tea tree oil soap, the pink dye started coming off which is so disturbing! Luckily, I texted the artist for the original sponge she used and bought a whole bunch. The craziest part- the sponges she used which were so superior to this one (brand was AOA Wonder Blend), are a fraction of the cost found on other sites.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received this complimentary in exchange for an honest review. I have quite oily skin, and my makeup always slips off throughout the day. This not only keeps my foundation from looking super shiny all day, it also helps to keep my original slay looking 100.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've used other cheap makeup sponges from the drugstore and this one is definitely superior. I used it wet as directed and applied foundation, concealer, and translucent powder and was very impressed to see that it really does only absorb excess product in the perfect way... it saves you from yourself. If you have too much product, it takes some away, if you don't have enough, it won't strip it off.

reviews.review_title: Nothing Compares To This Original! Itu2019s The Best!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve tried so many different u201cbeauty blendersu201d and none are as good as the original right here! This has a secret that the others canu2019t seem to copy or get exactly right! Once this gets damp with water and all excess water squeezed out; this becomes soft and blends foundation with ease! It makes foundation glide onto the skin yet blends it like a clean layer of new skin!! This is so easy to clean too and doesnu2019t hold soap and makeup deep inside of it like others do! The size fits perfectly in your hand and the pointed tip is the perfect angle to get the corner of your eyes and nose! Use the side walls to apply the foundation first, the pointed for hard to reach areas and the bottom bigger area for blending the final look! I love all the different colors you can get and different sizes but the pink original beauty blender is the best one personally! The white one you can you for blending serums into your skin or moisturizer, the black is for contouring, pink is for every day makeup and applying liquid foundation and the minis are for the under eye, corner of eyes and nose and if you want more a precise look! They make the best makeup brush cleanser that works incredibly well getting all the makeup off the blender and on brushes as well! For $20 you canu2019t beat what you get and what this does! Itu2019s a must have in any persons makeup kit!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love it! I have really dry skin, using the beauty blender always gives me a beautiful application and doesn't leave me looking cakey.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The Beauty Blender was my go-to when I first started make-up. I recently switched to a different brand, but needed to buy 1 sponge, so decided to try the Beauty Blender again. However, for some reason, the new Beauty Blenders keep have the pink dye come out when I wash it? The previous ones never did, so it is a bit concerning, considering I wash mine with each use, and I've had it for almost month already.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019m not going to sugar coat. This beauty blender changed everything. I started off with brushes. When I thought about a beauty blender, I was not keen on buying an egg for twenty dollars. If you are hesitant, donu2019t be. Yes, itu2019s pricey but itu2019s worth it. It blends everything so smoothly. It blends very seamlessly!! My foundation is not streaky, compared to a brush. A beauty blender is a must in every makeup bag. I do recommend to wash your beauty blender frequently for sanitary reasons. ITu2019S AWESOME!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love love love the beauty blender for foundation application! I see some bad reviews saying the blender absorbed their product. Itu2019s very important to fully soak blender in warm water. Squeeze water out and then use. I put my foundation on the back of my clean hand and dip the blender in it and apply to my face. I am able to clean after use and the foundation rinses out very easily. I use Johnsonu2019s baby soap on my brushes to gently clean. I also use that on my beauty blenders and itu2019s gentle yet effective at removing make up and not damaging to the blender! They last a good amount of time. I find I use less product with the above method than when I use a brush or fingers. The finished complexion I get is beautiful and Iu2019m almost 44. I find when I use a brush the product sits in fine lines and looks mask like (YUK).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin

Until then I highly recommend this pink one!!

The texture is rough, doesnu2019t wash well, and it doesnu2019t absorb water so it doesnu2019t expand. Instead of bouncing the sponge on my face, itu2019s like smacking a stale dinner roll against my face. Will not repurchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Great product but please wash first. The pic s shows how pink the water turned after I washed it the SECOND TIME

I have never left a review before! I could never bring myself to spend $20 on a sponge! Iu2019ve tried so many from the drug stores that are actually good and work. But I went on a whim and wanted to splurge, and let me tell you!! Game changer! This sponge really is the hype!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love the beauty blender and have spent way more money on these things over the last 3 years than any sane person would. However, last like 6 months Iu2019ve used generic ones since I was on a budget. When I finally ran out, I saw a seasonal 3pk of purple bb that was on sale, which I couldnu2019t pass up 3 of these sponges for like 30 bux. However, they are absolutely not the same as this original pink one. The first one has gone in the trash after about 5 uses, and the second one Iu2019ve used once and itu2019s the same horrible quality as the first. So Iu2019m out 30 bux on sponges that are drug store quality.   That was last month. I went to Sephora the other day, and I asked the lady if they changed the quality or anything and she said no, and assured me that the original pink one is the same as it has always been. She suggested that maybe it had to do with the color. So I went ahead and bought one of the original pink ones. Iu2019ve used it twice and it is not the same as I remember it being. Itu2019s very porous, sucks up all my foundation and doesnu2019t rinse well either. Normally I would ring it out with a simple squeeze from a paper towel, which Iu2019ve done for the last 3 years, and they would have the perfect amount of moisture inside, and with this one, itu2019s like completely dried when I do that. I would be returning this if I hadnu2019t tossed out the packing. So now Iu2019m out another 20 bux.  This pink one isnu2019t as bad as that 3pk of purple ones I got, but itu2019s pretty close. I have a feeling that there must of been a cost increase to manufacture so they made a cheaper quality product to keep the price at $20 instead of just increasing the cost and keeping the high quality that we know and love. Or maybe they just want to maximize profits and changed the quality just cause they can...but for whatever reason it is, I will not be purchasing this again unless they go back to the original formula. Iu2019ve gotten better sponges at Walmart for a 1/4 of the price.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this recently and after the first use I noticed a major quality difference. It absorbs way more product and doesn't wash out and it just feels off. It feels more scratchy and the product doesn't cover as well as it used to. After shelling out twenty bucks I'm thoroughly disappointed. Unfortunately I don't think I can return it now since it's been more than 30 days, but definitely never getting it again. Majorly disappointed in their change in quality.

reviews.review_title: thumbs up if uve noticed a change in the last year

reviews.review_text: Please leave a thumbs up if you have noticed a quality difference within the last year from beauty blender!! Iu2019ve religiously and happily forked over $20 for these for year, Iu2019ve gotten many friends and family hooked. It feels softer and less bouncey more like the fenty sponge, it is NOT color fast after at least a dozen washes, and generally isnu2019t holding up as well after washing.

Go on and experience the Real Thing! An ice cold Coke! The caffeine and sugar will keep you buzzing while you sponge your makeup on ;) Seriously, the Beauty Blender is a classic. However I do reach for my beauty blender more, probably because it has a more precise tip than the real techniques. But when I travel I reach for my real techniques one and never bring my bb. In general when I travel I take the cheaper option so I donu2019t feel bad when it gets lost or damaged. Overall this beauty blender is a wonderful tool to have. I strongly recommend washing properly after every single use.. itu2019s a sponge and sponges harbor bacteria and germs. Iu2019ve used shampoo and it works but definitely requires elbow grease. I do prefer the beauty blender solutions specifically the solid formula. I recommend looking out for beauty blender deals which they have peppered in all year round but usually during the holidays the big daddy deals come out. I got another at Christmas and I've probably only used it about 15 times, and when I picked it up a few days ago I discovered that there's black mould throughout the pores of the pink sponge!! I have a black pro BB sponge that's still in good condition but now I'm worried to continue using it because if it actually were mouldy I'd have no idea. I'd really like to buy a sponge with the assurance that it will perform as good as the one I bought 5 years ago.

reviews.review_text: After you use the sponge you cannot go backwards, it's simply better than all the others. If you read the instruction packet that comes with it, it will clearly tell you during the first few rinsings it's going to release pink dye but it's not a big deal. The reason I love this sponge is because it's got a wonderful bouncy texture and that's perfect for a sponge. It's also easy to maneuver because it's not too big, so it can really get into the creases under your eye. Youu don't need to buy both mini sponges and the regular ones because this product can do every job. I love that it's not big and goofy, but its big enough to really get around your cheeks as well. You can really get a wonderful makeup application and I don't mind that sponges absorb some of the product because it keeps you from putting too much on your face, it offers a more natural look. I use both sponges and brushes. I like to use this for concealer and foundation, as well as other cream products. $20 is a lot for a sponge but it's worth it. I recommend buying two, one in pink and the other in black. You replace them every 3 months.

reviews.review_text: I received this product free in exchange for my honest option.  So I decided to really put this blender to the test and did my full face with it (minus the eyeliner, mascara, and eyebrows). Here are my thoughts: - For eyeshadow application: for the eyeshadow based, it worked well until it came to getting in the corners. Then I had to tug the eyelid which I hate doing. Then, it really seemed to dull the pigment. This gold is usually very bright and rich. To me, it appears really sad and washed out. - For foundation application: will never use again. Idk if itu2019s the damp blender or the foundation, but at first it seemed to apply nicely, but then what I noticed is that despite a light weight foundation, the product sat above my sink rather than actually blending in. It felt so strange I had to actually go back in with my foundation brush to fix it. - For my contouring and blush: I typically use a blender but dry. So i will use again but not wet. - I know itu2019s not the u201crightu201d way to use a beauty blender dry but honestly, I donu2019t care and I am not a fan of the damp blender in the slightest.    Would not pay $20 for something I got for $7 elsewhere.

reviews.review_text: I have not purchased a beautyblender in 2 years, but I received one in a box complimentary of Influenster for testing purposes and now I remember why this product is such a cult classic. Previously I used a Real Techniques complexion sponge which was good because it gave my skin more coverage when my skin was more acne prone, but now that my skin has less texture and dark spots the beautyblender provides even and radiant coverage in only one application of my foundation. When handling the sponge after using it, it doesn't transfer product on my fingertips either from use which is helpful for mornings when I am trying to complete my routine quickly because it don't have to wipe my hands and stain the outer parts of my other products. I recently have been using the larger rounded section of the sponge for my face which I can dab into the smaller sections of my face like my nose and between my brow with ease while I use the pointed part of the sponge for dotting and blending my highlighter. I would purchase this product if it came in a value set, but it is not a holy grail makeup tool for me to purchase separately for 20 dollars.

reviews.review_text: I remember back when the BeautyBlender first became trendy on online beauty circles back in 2011-ish. It was a funny shape, expensive for a sponge, and unlike anything anyone had seen before, but all of the YouTube beauty gurus were raving about it.  Back then, I bought a little knockoff sponge from CVS, which I still have (not with me here in my DC apartment, unfortunately, or else Iu2019d provide a comparison photo). It was squishy, bouncy, and held water like it was supposed to, and it was half the price of the BeautyBlender. It was my favorite way to apply makeup for a while, before I discovered the RealTechniques buffing brush which changed my life forever.  So now, in 2019, is the BeautyBlender sponge worth it?  Ehu2026itu2019s worth it to buy an egg-shaped sponge, absolutely. Thereu2019s really nothing better than a wet sponge for liquid foundation application, if you ask me, if you have the time in the morning to wet a sponge and spend a minute or two sitting there and bouncing it on your face. Itu2019s not a part of my daily makeup routine because it takes too long and Iu2019m usually in a rush (hence, the buffing brush), but I like one for special occasions where I want my makeup to look really flawless.  I appreciate the BeautyBlender for being the first of its kind and totally revolutionary, but the thing is, you can buy similar makeup sponges Thereu2019s no reason in this case to buy name brand, if you ask me. Go buy a knockoff. Like I said, the CVS generic brand one is pretty good (or at least, it was when I was in 8th grade and I first bought it). As I hear, RealTechniques has a comparable makeup sponge too.

reviews.review_text: I love a good beautyblender. I've gone through maybe 5 or 6 of them personally and I recently received one complimentary for testing purposes.  The size is perfect. I have a makeup sponge from another brand that I love for blending foundation, but it's too big for concealing under my eyes. This one can do both and somehow elevates my foundation to a more beautiful finish than a brush. I tried that strange microfiber sponge from Juno, and it made any foundation that I used very matte. The beautyblender maintains the intended finish.   My only personal dislike for beautyblenders is that I'm all about a clean look, and no matter how well you clean it some stains will remain. Not a hygiene issue, just bothersome appearance wise.   Overall, it's a very efficient way to blend foundation (and concealer, cream highlight, cream bronzer, etc), and never leave me with streaks.   4 stars just because there are so many sponges on the market now and $20 is steep in comparison. I've read that you should replace the sponge every 3 months, so the price can add up. In comparison, the price of a brush stretches over a much longer time frame.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I never ever thought I would become a beauty blender type of girl vs a brush type of girl. For years and years I have stayed away from the beauty blender because I just felt like brushed were better. I thought the beauty blender would u201cwater-downu201d your makeup and absorb most of the product. I would buy other sponges and just use them for baking purposes. Everyone would say there are several other sponges that do just as well of a job as the original but I just donu2019t think itu2019s true. I have been receiving so many compliments on my makeup ever since I started using this! I no longer worry about streaks. It doesnu2019t absorb your foundation at all (or at least not to where you feel like most of your foundation is going into the sponge). I use it with my NARS radiant foundation and it doesnu2019t sheer it out, which I love! It keeps the coverage! I also use it for my concealer and I hardly ever touch my brush now! Itu2019s definitely worth itu2014 and I do think itu2019s worth choosing over the dupes out there. It makes applying makeup so much easier + faster!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve ALWAYS used beauty blenders to apply my foundation. I usually use the RT ones but if iu2019m being honest, iu2019ve tried beauty blenders from my local dollar stores as well as they do the trick and they seem to actually do a decent job. That being said, I was ready to finally try the u201crealu201d beauty blender and Itu2019s nothing like I expected. I truly donu2019t see what all the hype is about. Half way through doing my makeup, I stopped using my u201crealu201d beauty blender and switched to my THREE DOLLAR u201cfakeu201d beauty blender that i bought at the dollar store. Such a sheer/light coverage! The price DOES NOT match the quality in my opinion.

reviews.review_text: This used to be my go-to for applying my foundation and concealer, however the quality of the product has drastically changed within the last year and a half. My OG blenders would last me forever, however I'm lucky to use the newer ones for a few weeks before they start to tear or leave little pink flecks of sponge on my face. My last three have had to be replaced within 4 weeks. Super disappointing considering the high price of a sponge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: the original beautyblender beauty queen pink original and the cleansing mitt - wow...if I could give zero star, I would. These products are so amazingly bad, I am just speechless. They were not cheap. Beauty blender costs $20 and the cleansing mitt also costs $20. So, I am out $40+tax+shipping, and all I can show for it is junk. The blender fell apart only after the FIRST cleansing attempt. And as you can see the makeup  residue is still there. Mind you I used their soap and their shampoo. And as you can see from my photo the mitt is also covered in residual makeup, meaning that water and soap will not wash it away! It just transfers from one serface (the beauty blender) to the other surface (the mitt). I wonder what is the purpose of soap and shampoo if it is still the same after the cleansing. This is only after one use. ONE SINGLE USE! I am blown away just how awful these products are. I used Sephora soap before on my brushes and cheap blender sponges, and they were amazing. But this time since this was my 1st Beauty Blender I wanted to take care of it properly and bought the cleansing mitt along with the soap and the shampoo from the same brand. I am very disappointed that the price-y products did not do anything. Just WOW. Do not buy this garbage. Donu2019t be a sucker like me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019m never going back to using a brush to apply my makeup. My makeup looks flawless every single time when I use this product. I even apply my setting powder with this and it makes my face look so airbrushed and smooth.

reviews.review_title: So Much Better Than Other Sponges
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've used pretty much every beauty sponge (EcoTools, Real Techniques, Morphe, some random ones from TJ Maxx, and more) and the Beauty Blender is so much better than the rest of them.  It's amazing.  Period.  I'm shocked by how soft it is and how well it blends my foundation.  The size is perfect and it's super easy to clean.  One of the biggest issues I've had with other sponges is that it's impossible to have one for more than a couple weeks without them ripping.  I replace my BB every three months and I've never had one rip or tear at all.  I've also started apply powder with my BB, something I couldn't do with another sponge without it looking super cakey.  Overall, it's definitely worth the cost.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was pretty skeptical about spending $20 on a sponge when I thought my foundation brush worked just fine.. but after watching many review videos I finally decided to purchase beauty blender... I AM IN LOVE!!! I thought my brush did the job just fine... I had no idea how flawless my make up could have been looking all this time. The beauty blender makes my make up look so smooth and perfectly blended out. A couple months ago I tried a $6 one from the drug store but I just wasnu2019t happy with the results..  BEAUTY BLENDER IS WORTH THE $20

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have only used this a couple of times and I donu2019t see much purpose and it does not come clean. I even tried dish soap. I liked the idea of not having to wash my hands after I applied my makeup but I still found I needed to use my fingertips to make everything look seamless so Iu2019m back to using my finger for the whole application. I also use much less product when I use my fingers since they donu2019t absorb all the product. So is money is a concern this is not for you. I was instructed how to use it but as you lightly tap it to your skin it pushed the product deeper into the sponge. I get much more natural results with much less product by lighting tapping my fingers over my skin. It is cute and comes in a nice little container that also works as a good place to put it to dry after you try to wash it. I also think since I canu2019t get all the product cleaned off of the surface of it there must be germs and product that gets stuck deep into the sponge that isnu2019t removable so it could cause some bad skin reactions for those of us who have sensitive skin and or like to keep clean any thing that is going near our eyes, lips, nose and mouth. I wouldnu2019t let my daughters use it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The best applicator - applies my foundation considerably better than wedge sponges or brushes. Since trying beauty blender last year, it is the only thing I use to apply my makeup.   4 instead of 5 stars for two reasons: 1) longevity - need to be replaced every 2-3 months (yup, that's $100  in beauty blenders per year, but even more annoying is the inconvenience of reordering all the time ). 2) sanitation - almost gave up on beauty blender because two of mine developed black mold. After buying blender cleanser solid, did not have an issue with this. In my opinion, buying a cleanser is required - beauty blender will without a doubt develop mold if a cleanser is not used. That being said, blender cleanser (solid) works super well and I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_text: I won't use any other makeup sponge besides a Beauty Blender because in my opinion I haven't found one that comes close to giving me results like a Beauty Blender does. It has a one of a kind soft airy spongy texture that absorbs the perfect amount of product then distributes it to the face in a way no other beauty sponge can. I have tried other makeup sponges that either absorb to much product then not release it back on the face when pouncing onto the skin. Or some that don't absorb product at all & you're just pushing the product around on your face to finish with this big streaky looking mess. $20 maybe expensive for one makeup sponge but my Beauty Blender does last me a good 6 months & that's me using it 5 to 6 days a week & washing it before & after every use. So that's me washing it 10-12 times a week & still Lasting a good 6 months. To me the $40 a year is worth it because the results are amazing. Yeah you can dupe it for maybe half the price but in the end you're spend more because the cheaper dupes don't last long, fall apart way to easily & don't have the texture as a Original Beauty Blender!

reviews.review_title: Great for aging skin!   The hype is real!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm 37, so my skin has changed and I have had to completely overhaul my makeup routine.   I used to have oily skin, now it's dry, and my complexion is extremely pale, so if makeup creases, it is painfully obvious.   Liquid foundations and concealers are what I use now that my skin is dry.   The liquid component of this blends with the wetness of the blender amazingly well.  The product saves me time and embarrassment!!!   Also it's soft, the texture is perfect and light, so when i dab my face with it, my heavy handedness doesn't get in the way.   I waited a long time to try this because I thought it was a gimmick.   When I got a free sample, i tried it and now I'm a believer.   For those struggling with it, i highly recommend watching videos on how to use it for the best results, because this product does require some forethought/strategy before using on your face.  But it's easy, and my little fine lines and wrinkles are smooth.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This will change your makeup routine forever. You will never go back. It applies foundation without being streaky or sticking to dry spots. It also blends cream contours and concealers like a dream.

reviews.review_text: For a sponge many people may think that it is pricey, however i have tried almost every sponge on the marker and this is far by the best. I can see why so many people adore this product, it hardly soaks up any foundation and gives a beautiful finish. I do however, like a very very natural look so when i use foundation I like to use the real techniques sponge which DOES soak up some product and sheers it out. The beauty blender paired with a bb or cc cream is a dream combination. The sponge applies the lightweight bb/cc cream in such a natural way but since no product is absorbed it will give you the most coverage out of anything.

reviews.review_text: It took me a long time to use a sponge versus brushes and Iu2019m so glad I made the switch! I started with cheap sponges and almost gave up right from the start but then decided to spend the money on this sponge and itu2019s seriously the only one that applies my makeup well without keeping it all on the sponge. I use it for my foundations as well as powders and it makes my makeup look better than it ever did with brushes. Brushes work great for some people but for me Iu2019m now a die hard beauty blender fan! I make sure I wash and dry my sponge properly after every use and replace every ~3 months. Iu2019ve never had a problem with the dye of the sponge or it removing my makeup while applying. Worth the money for me!

reviews.review_text: I really enjoy the BB.  I find that it applies my foundation and concealer nicely, or rather blends it out nicely.  I've never been a brush woman for these base products, so for me it's simply much nicer than the old triangle sponges.  I enjoy the colour selections, and shape they offer.  Its not a five star product for me simply because I find that I can get the same effect from a specific much less expensive sponge. It's also fantastic for applying powder to the endereyes and face.  I find when I apply powder with my BB. it melts into the skin instead of just sitting on top of it looking powdery.  Well worth it for its versatility.

reviews.review_text: I have tried all sorts of beauty blender knock offs, and I havenu2019t really liked any of them. I was quite  confused as to why everybody and their moms were raving about beauty blenders, because I figured all of the egg shaped makeup sponges out there were the same. I thought I was better off getting the u201csame thingu201d from the drugstore for $15 less, BUT BOY WAS I WRONG!!! I was way more than pleasantly surprised when I tried a beauty blender for the first time! The overall material of the beauty blender is way better than the ones I had previously tried- weu2019re talking 9 beauty sponges from different brands (including the real techniques sponge). I have never been more shocked trying a product. Definitely exceeded my expectations. I can proudly say that I will never go back to using anything other than a beauty blender to apply my foundation. If you have been contemplating buying this product because of the price, let me tell you, itu2019s 100% worth it! ...that is if you wear foundation of course. I was quite nervous spending $20 on a sponge, especially considering how inexpensive other brands sell similar sponges for, but the entirety of the product is far from the same. Moral of the story, buy a beauty blender!!! You wonu2019t regret it! I know I donu2019t!

reviews.review_title: Good for a skin-like foundation finish
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I like to use a beautyblender for foundation. It really presses the product into the skin rather than swiping and moving it around like a brush. It gives that skin-like finish for foundation. It only soaks up product if you use too much product to start: I apply my foundation in small dots on my face and then go in with the beautyblender and I get minimal stains on it. I donu2019t use any specific cleanser for it, just a gentle shampoo or even regular liquid or bar hand soap and the stains come out. Itu2019s more compact and less bulky than a brush and it fits better in my small travel makeup bag. My only gripe is the cost, since there are other sponges that work as well for a fraction of the price. But overall good product

I had had the beauty blender for under a month- two to three weeks- when i noticed mold starting to grow on it. I was astoinished because I had always cleaned it after use and let it dry completely. I continued to clean it and let it dry and kept it bear a window to see if conditions would improve. No matter what I did the mold would not leave. Eventually i tried to pick the mold out, which just ended in a no longer usable beauty blender. I decided to just toss it. It was good when it lasted but not worth the money in my opinion. I would reccomend the sephora knock off more than this.

reviews.review_text: I've had a long hiatus with the Orignial Beauty Blender, almost two year. However, I recently starting using the BB again! I really haven't been able to find a spring quite as soft and gentle as the BB. It applies my liquid foundations flawlessly, and since the sponge is damp, my skin gets some added moisture compared to a brush application. I'm blessed with rather clear clear skin, so I also love how the BB thins out fuller coverage foundation for a more dewy, natural finish. This is my favorite tool to apply concealer since it's tip fits perfectly under the eye. I knocked off one star because the BB stays rather small, compared to other sponges I've tried such as EcoTools and Sonia Kashuk. I wish it would be just a tad larger so application took less time, but since the results are flawless, I can't complain too much.   A new technique I've been trying thanks to the YouTube beauty community is applying powder to bake using a DRY BB. I find it more precise and less messy than applying with a brush or puff.   Overall, BB takes the 1st place prize for a beautiful finish and soft texture, but comes in second for size. 9/10 would recommend.   I got this product free for testing purchases.

reviews.review_text: The new limited edition 'Beauty Queen' packaging is so glam and cute; I'm a beauty queen so really appreciate the limited edition packaging <3 I switched to the Beauty Blender 2-3 years ago and my makeup bag's never without it. Before using the Beauty Blender I was using Kevin Aucoin and Armani's foundation brushes. The difference with the Beauty Blender is that you can really control how much coverage you have, it doesn't create brushmarks or streaks, and is easy to clean.   I use it for both my foundation (liquid and airbrush) and under eye concealer as the tip makes getting into the corners of the eyes and around the nose easy with no missed spots. The best way to use it is either to apply your liquid foundation with your fingers first then bounce and/or roll the damp beauty blender to evenly distribute product. With the airbrush, I spray on my face then dab the beauty blender over my face before spraying product directly to the sponge and applying that to areas I want more coverage such as my nose.  If people are saying it eats up product, they're probably using the sponge dry; which of course will make it absorb the product which is why using it damp is so important. Also, be sure to clean your beauty blender with your keep.it.clean mitt or solid cleanser after each use to prevent the build-up of bacteria.   I received this product for free for testing purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love the original beauty blender! It is the best make up sponge I have found, as the texture is soft and pliable, so it spreads foundation with ease and comfort. I typically wet the palm of my hand before dabbing the sponge in the excess water from my hand 2-3 times before dabbing makeup directly onto my face and using the sponge to blend it all together. I have found that this technique allows most of the makeup to remain on my skin instead of the sponge. I have tried other make up sponges, but found the texture to be much harder (the beauty blender really is super fluffy and soft), so the makeup is more harshly rubbed into my face with these.

Previously, I was using a silicon fave scrubber to clean my brushes, but the keep.it.clean is a great size to make and makes is a lot faster to clean my tools. I like to soak my sponge and squeeze it out and lightly dampen it again in order for it not to soak up product. I thoroughly enjoy the cleanser that they include that smells wonderful but works so much better than any soap and coconut oil combination out there. The scrubbing mat not only cleans my sponge and increases cleanliness of my make up application, but also cleans other brushes with ease. Traveling with my beauty blender is made easy with the small cleanser and mat as well.

reviews.review_text: The beauty blender revolutionized my make-up routine and changed my life. I am not exaggerating. It makes your make-up feel weightless and like it's not even there, which is perfect for me as I get itchy face if my make-up is too thick. It is perfect for foundation (I used Too Faced in the shade Porcelain) and together they are just perfect. The big round end is great for over your entire face and the pointed top is awesome for smaller details, like under the eyes. It is also amazing for other things, such as blush. I recently tried my first creme (as opposed to powder) blush, with the beauty blender, it is amazing. At first, I wasn't sure -- $20 on a SPONGE? But I got a cheaper dupe and fell in love with that, so decided to try the real thing. The real thing is even better than the dupes. I love my beauty blender so much I could cry

reviews.review_title: Everything's compared to the BB for a reason
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I waffled on this for a long time. I used the Real Techiniques Miracle Complexion Sponge for a couple years because I watched numerous videos comparing it favorably as a dupe. However, the RT sponge breaks up and splits way too quickly for my liking (sometimes it would take a month or so, other times after a few washes - and I am gentle!), so I finally bit the bullet. It was completely worth it!   The Beautyblender is more bouncy and less dense. It applies foundations that I find tricky with my fingers or a brush much better than the RT. I don't find myself missing the flat side of the RT sponge either, which surprised me. And, bonus, this cleans so much easier than the RT sponge, and I don't worry that it's going to start splitting. I use the SheaMoisture African Black Soap bar, which works effectively and gently. I've tried many other cheaper alternative sponges that Influencers rave about since, and I still haven't found anything that I love more. I can't see myself every going back to another sponge. There are still products that apply better with fingers or a brush, but for a sponge, nothing beats the BeautyBlender.   The only downside is that for many washes it bleeds pink when I clean it. It doesn't effect my foundation (it only bleeds when I use soap), but I don't like the idea that there's so much dye in there. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love using the Beauty Blender for applying foundation and concealer, especially under my eyes where I'm the driest and tend to show creases the most. I've been using the Original pink one for years, and yes, you have to be careful with it or it will tear easily while wetting or cleaning it. My suggestion is to allow the water to soak into it while sitting in a mug of water next to the sink. Then take it out and squeeze it between your palms, not in one hand where your nails can dig in. Do this once or twice and it should be fully absorbed with water. Once full, squeeze water out with a towel and you're all set!  Another thing I noticed is that the Beauty Blender Pro (the black sponge) tends to be a bit smaller, but also more durable and less apt to getting holes or tearing. I also noticed that it doesn't get as big, even when wet but it works just as well.  What I love about this simple looking little sponge is that it allows me to use less makeup while getting a seamless finish. I'm able to use the pointed end to apply concealer to my eyelids (my preferred eye primer) perfectly and evenly without tugging at the delicate skin around the eye. I'm also able to blend foundation and concealer together perfectly for a seamless transition with minimal increasing under my eyes. And although I don't bake (I'm 46 years old), I sometimes will use the sponge to add translucent powder or highlighter to my face and it gives the perfect finish! The suggested replacement on these is every 3 months, however if you are very good at cleaning yours every time you use it and storing it in a covered place, like a drawer or something (after it's fully air dried, of course), I think it will last way longer than that. Mine certainly have!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My fave for foundation and concealer. I use all my products with liquid bases by applying them all with this...man this item is a wonder. You must use it skillfully and don't over dampen it with water. It's a miracle tool and so great with setting concealer. Love love love! It's a freaking MUST HAVE!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: so I don't wear foundation every day. I wear it at most once a week, and sometimes less often. I absolutely love the way the beauty blender makes my foundation look. it doesnt absorb product so I'm using less foundation than other sponges and it goes on flawlessly. but now there are black spots on my blender which has been confirmed to be mould.   The woman at Sephora explained that the blender will get mould if not stored at proper temperatures and in dry places, without being contained in anything. When I bought it they said it would be fine to store in the container it comes in but without the lid which is what I've been doing. now they tell me that's wrong. She explained that the blender should be replaced every 3 to 4 months regardless of mould or not. and apparently sometimes there is mould inside and you don't even see it!!   So now I'm hesitant about whether or not I should buy another one because to spend 30$ on something I only used about 10 - 15 times is a waste of money. My friend's blender is completely beige/brown now and mine is still pink except the bottom and the point. it hasn't been used much.   So if you plan on getting it, cleaning it with the soap bar that they sell is a must! she said it reduces the risk of mould by a lot. you have to wash ir after every use. and do not store it in a ziplock bag, plastic container, anywhere enclosed, or anywhere humid. and if you've had it forever, replace it, and keep replacing it every 3 months. As soon as you notice little black dots (almost barely noticeable at first) your blender is finished so check it every so often because it's very easy to miss it and no one wants to be putting mould on their face.

It's more sheer than a brush, but depending on the foundation you can build coverage easily. I wash mine with BB solid soap after every use to get the most out of it. I subtracted a star because it can lacerate fairly easily when wet, and when it lacerates it doesn't work very well. It takes on water differently and it has soaked up a massive amount of foundation that I can't wash out. I will be more delicate with my next sponge.

reviews.review_text: The best sponge out there. It blends nicely and doesn't drink up all your expensive foundation.  That being said I still don't use it on the daily or weekly. It's nice but I feel like it takes too long in comparison to using a dense buffing brush and the brush gives me a fuller coverage than the sponge. You can definitely build it up with the beauty blender just takes a bit more time. Sometimes, I use both of them together I'll put my foundation on with my brush blend a bit and then use the beauty blender for the last touch. Or, if I overdid it i can use it to blend it out a bit more.   Beauty Blender is great tool, you just got to see how It fits your routine. I will continue to have one in my tool set, it's nifty to have for those days i have more time.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like the blender, but the price is tough. Mine peeled and became a mess... ordered another and ended up going back to a foundation brush again... still love it though
This is by far the best makeup sponge out there, it blends beautifully and lasts a decent amount of time.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Always had the bigger black one before but this one is just as good!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Good product but very expensive and not much difference from less expensive blenders

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have 6 Beauty Blenders and I cannot live without them when applying foundation, concealer, and while doing my melting technique with powder for a matte finish. I love to spray my Beauty Blender with finishing spray after I bake and then dab it onto the powdered areas on my face to get a more matte look.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Theses sponges are nice to work with, but come on, seriously, 28 buck for sponge that rips after a month or month and a half? What a joke!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried this product because of the hype. Altogether, I am not disappointed by the product. It gives a very good finish and I like the texture. However, some of the dye came off when I washed it... For 30$, I don't think I will rebuy. I love the real technique sponge and it is for a much better price. If you want to invest, it is worth it as the quality is great, but if you are a beginner or don't like to spend a lot of money on makeup, I would recommend to look at other options.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: i honestly didn't think this would work and always stayed away from buying it but i caved and it WAS SO WORTH IT! Blends out foundation so well! Feels so soft on the skin!
Last for over a year but once I saw mold I tossed it .

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love this sponge, it applies my foundation beautifully and easily. Seems to be lasting me a long time as well and very easy clean. It is a little pricey though so there are probably some cheaper dupes out there.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I finally splurged and purchased a BeautyBlender since I keep hearing and reading so much about it. I figured it would be just another 'makeup sponge.' Boy, was I wrong. I love it. It blends so nice and easy!
No need to say , go get it girl !

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The beauty blender allows for a flawless application of my makeup. However, you do need to buy a new one every 3-4 months after use as mold (black dots) begins to grow on it no matter how many times you wash it and air dry it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this beauty sponge, it blends the product evenly

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this makeup tool, it blends beautifully and makes your foundation look so smooth. It does pick up a lot of makeup but what sponge doesn't.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not bouncy whatsoever. Doesn't soak up much product. Fits great under the eye. But pretty much pushes your skin around. It's soft, don't get me wrong. It just doesn't bounce at all!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I never used to use sponges to apply my foundation but after reading about these for so long, I finally decided to give it a try. I definitely see what I've been missing. This applies my makeup so flawlessly. It makes getting into those hard to blend areas (around my nose, under my eyes, etc) so much easier. I'll never go back to a brush.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Worth every penny! Blends foundation, concealer, blush, baking - everything beautifully. Easy to clean. Hard to live without. Perfection.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: So great at blending! It is hard to clean properly though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've tried various dupes of the beauty blender and this one is the best by far. It is pricey, but lasts forever. Highly recommended.

This sponge is popular for a reason, it works. It's great for foundation, concealer, cream contour, and powder. The finish this gives is amazing and you can blend everything out so smoothly. The only draw back is that it sucks up more product than a brush.
Had to wash it like 10 times before first usage - it kept on giving the pink pigment into the water.. I was worried that it will make my foundation look pink..

reviews.review_title: Best CC cream and  foundation applicator ever
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have this in white and I love it!  It helps my make up go on flawlessly!  I've gotten so use to the way it makes my skin look, that I kinda took it for granted.  But when I recently forgot it on a weekend trip and hadn't to use my blurring brush and fingers, I realized what a staple this magic blending sponge is. My skin just didn't look the same and my make up looked cakey. And the worst is that the difference showed in picture and i just didn't feel confident. I know own 3.  One for home, one in my car and one always packed in my travel bag so I'm never caught with out it again!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really love the way this blends out my foundation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: so I waited till now to get a beauty blender cause I felt the hype wasn't worth it but I was so wrong. for some reason my skin is extremely picky with what i blend with and this gives me a very beautiful natural finish!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: NEVER againu2026 i started using my beautyblender about a month ago. thins morning i went to use it and it was moldy. i will never purchase another. waste of money.
I was skeptical but I really love this blender

I love using the BeautyBlender to apply my foundation, concealer, and occasionally my setting powder. I haven't found a dupe that blends as good as it. The price for a sponge does seem pretty high, but I will have to admit that I will continue purchasing it. It gets the job done! I've noticed that if you clean your BB each time before using it, its longevity increases. I haven't tried the Blender Cleanser but I do look forward in purchasing it.

Phenomenal, that's all I have to say about the beauty blender I bought mine from Sephora and I've tried so MANY dupes! I know this is the same as what everyone else says but, it's true; you get what you paid for. This is so much easier to use versus a brush; with a brush you have to do all the work. When I use my beauty blender not only does my foundation go on smoother but I don't have the awful added in lines on my face that I get with a regular sponge. If you buy one of the dupes they aren't worth it, I've tried so many and all they really do is make your face redder than it was in the first place; the foundation doesn't blend as easily with a dupe and it's really not worth spending $1-$10 on a rock like sponge. The beauty blender is worth the $20 dollars, it really is worth the hype!
Pricey but it's worth it. Really helps blend out foundation flawlessly
This product works like a charm!
I thought $20 for a sponge was ridiculous but this beauty blender is so worth it. Real techniques is good but it's just not as soft as this sponge.
Blends foundation amazing. Application is easy. I prefer this over a brush. I'm glad I invested in this.
Best makeup application I've ever done!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly don't like using brushes anymore I find the beauty blender blends it in to your skin much better than a brush and the brushes sometimes don't leave an even finish whereas the beauty blender does

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This does soak up a little product, but this is the best way to apply my foundation by far. Brushes can only do so much for my skin and after a while it would look cakey. With the beauty blender it would prevent that from even happening to me because the foundation would be worked into my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Firstly, this sponge is amazing and there is nothing else out on the market right now that can blend like this one BUT I only gave it 4 stars because of the durability of the last 3 beauty blenders I've owned. My first one lasted me a whole year without shredding, and the last 3 I have purchased started to shred 2-3 months after using them. I continue to buy them though because I really don't like brushes for foundation and all of the mock beauty blenders that I've used like real techniques just do not blend the same way that the beauty blender does.
its a staple in my makeup bag. everyday i come back to it
I use this over and over!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I bought the beautyblender because it was recommended to me instead of the Real Techniques blending sponge, which I had been using for a while (and which costs a quarter of the price). Using the beautyblender, however, was a serious letdown. While the Real Techniques sponge has pores so fine the surface feels almost smooth, the beautyblender feels like a kitchen sponge. It felt rough and harsh against the skin, and I felt as though it did an inferior job of applying makeup. For $20, I felt as though I'd been scammed out of my money. Sticking with Real Techniques forever.

reviews.review_title: The best blender I have ever used!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The best blender I have ever used! Before using this one, I bought different brands of Blender, but I throw them away after the first use until I bought this one. At first, I thought this one kinda little expensive for me, after used I think I don't want to change it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried so many other dupes for the beauty blender in hopes of finding a similar result for less and have been so disappointed. The money I have spent trying to find dupes could have been used on stocking up on these babies!
I've tried other blenders that I like but I always go back to this one. I love this finish it gives
love it .its perfect for my foundation & setting  powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is a game changer. Once I figured out how to use it, I never have done my makeup without one. You need this in your life. The other dupes of this just don't come close.
There is no comparison. I have strayed but I never stray for long. The best way to apply foundation or any face product. Liquid foundation, concealer, even powder!

reviews.review_title: Really Good Product, But Quite Expensive...
reviews.review_text: I highly recommend this product after having made several comparison with other brands of makeup sponges, as well as foundation brushes. It texture feels really nice and soft on the face and it doesn't leave any streaks like foundation brushes do. Also, it covers the pores quite well on areas that's sometimes hard to reach. The only downside is that it does easily absorb quite a lot of foundation, so I usually have to use more foundation than usual to achieve the coverage I want (foundation brushes does a better job at higher coverage, but I don't really like the streaky finish), as well as making it a tad bit difficult to clean the sponge (since I don't clean it often or maybe I am just cleaning it wrong lol) Anyways, this product does its job well, but the price makes me slightly unlikely to repurchase often.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've tried dupes & they have been OK however nothing compares to the BB. The best for foundation, setting powder, cream products & toning down any excess product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this blender!   I use it to apply and blend my foundation.  It gives my foundation a beautiful finish. I used a smaller blender around my eyes. I do make sure to lightly clean it after every use and place it in a well ventilated area.  I live in a high humidity and temperature environment during the summer and lost a blender to mold. *sobs*
Every one should own at least one!

At first I was unconvinced that this Beautyblender would be any different than the knockoff ones you can get at a department store, but boy was I wrong. I will never buy any other sponge again. It works flawlessly, the shape is amazing for every inch of your face and I'm so in love with it. Definitely recommend. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I looooove my beauty blender. I truly don't think I could count how many I have bought. It always makes my makeup look very natural and so blended. My only issue is how quickly it can mold. I recently had one completely covered in mold that I had only had for a month. But on the bright side, my cats really like to play with the old ones I throw away.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I mean.....it's ok. I expected more with all the hype and cult following happening. I do like it, but I still like my brushes better and definitely never use it solo.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Great quality. Nice with blending. Color wear off and mold will start growing if not replacing.

My makeup routine would not be the same without this beauty blender. I especially like the pink one because the color doesn't wash away and it never fails to blend out my foundation. I didn't want to purchase this for a long while because I didn't want to spend the $20, but now I don't know what I  would do without it.
Absolutely love using these. Personally for myself rather than in my kit.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love a BB for the finish it gives my foundation. I do not think it soaks up too much product either. It leaves a natural finish and keeps things looking more evenly applied. I bouncebouncebounce and can control the sheerness by not squeezing too much of the water out. It also keeps me from tugging on my face with my fingers and irritating it with brush bristles, sometimes my skin is really sensitive.

I use this for my Dr Jart BB cream and I love the way it applies! I was using my fingers before, and didn't like the finish I was getting. This leaves my skin looking dewy, refreshed and that no make up, makeup look. LOVE.

Absolutely love my BB, I'm on my second one, I replaced mine because I bought it a year ago, washed it every week with DR.Bronners Castile soap. Cleaned it very will, but still replaced it for hygienic purposes. Definitely a must try or even a must have. You'll fall in love with the first dab!<3

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is such an excellent tool to use! It blends in foundation and concealer so beautifully and even.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I honestly arrived late to the beauty blender craze because I thought it was just like any other sponge I've tried and that it could just be overrated, I gave it a few months before everybody forgot about it. Never in my life have I been so wrong! I've tried other sponges and it just doesn't compare, it blends and applies products so flawlessly. The material is so soft and the size is so perfect as well, I apply my foundation so quickly now.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this to put on foundation and setting powder.  It blends foundation into my skin so well. For me, I find it works better than my fingers.  I make sure to wash it after every use and this helps it keep from getting nasty and keep my skin free of acne.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I thought that this product was going to be a gimmicky it looks good in my head because everyone else loves it but was wrong. For years I have been having issues applying concealor under my eyes and making it blend into my natural skin since I don't use foundation. I've used sponges, brushes, my fingers, even switching concealer beliving that it was the product's fault not the technique. I was wrong. This sponge has changed my life. It makes blending easy! It's a must buy for everyone!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I used the beauty blender exclusively for a year to apply my foundation. It works very well and I have no plans to ever apply foundation with a brush. Recently, I started using the Sephora brand beauty sponge. I didn't even notice a difference in how my makeup looks compared to the original beauty blender. Therefore, I'm only giving this product 4 stars. I believe in buying expensive items if the cheaper version truly is of less quality. In this case, there isn't a tangible difference.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried literally every cheaper iteration of this product that is out there, and I keep coming back.  I usually keep 3-5 blenders at any given time that I use in rotation.  Nothing matches the feel and application of the original.    It will last 5-6 months when used with the Blendercleaser,

reviews.review_title: Great but needs to be cleaned regularly
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The Beauty Blender does a flawless job applying and blending makeup however I recently discovered mold growing on my blender! I had noticed an odd smell before noticing the green spots that had appeared. Just something to watch out for! I would definitely recommend cleaning as often as you can.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really enjoy this product. Initally preferred it dry but now I use it wet to apply both powders and liquids. Even for my highlighter!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: after trying dupe after dupe, I finally gave in to buying the real deal. I'm so glad I finally purchased it! It blends makeup so easily and makes it look seamless.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried all of the dupes, but nothing beats the real deal.  It blends all of my moisturizer, primer, foundation, liquid high light without skippinga beat.  There are very few things I don't use my blenders for. I've had several and I love them.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is honestly a makeup-lover's necessity. I have yet to find any other sponge as soft and blendable as the OG beauty blender!!! it's a bit pricey for a sponge, but at the end of the day it's worth it. love love love

I love my beautyblender sponge! It's my preferred way to apply foundation and cc cream. It doesn't absorb the products so I don't have to worry about wasting expensive foundation. It lasts forever as long as you keep it clean and store it properly.
I tried other BB that were les expensive and it's true...you get what you pay for. If you wear makeup, from minimal to glam, you need THE BeautyBlender (no knock off) in your life!
Applies your makeup flawlessly and seamlessly

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Makes foundation look lovely.  Can't imagine being without it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There is nothing quite like the original beauty blender.. others try but they're not the same.  I'll never stray! Perfect application every time!

Love it. The hype is real. Concealer game just got 10x better. The only minor inconvenience is, once wet, it's not very travel friendly. Also, I can't stand to see it dirty, so I usually wash it every night before bed, which gets a little tiring. Going on 2 months of use and daily washing, and it's still going strong!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
