reviews.review_text: I will never go back to a brush
Fantastic product. The shape and density of the sponge have made me much more efficient at applying my foundation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Color fades pretty easily.  Blends well, but I think it's overrated.

Even with thousands of positive reviews, I was still very skeptical about trying this. I finally did almost a year ago and am so happy with the results! This blender has truly helped perfect my blending skills (no more strikes and mask) and I couldn't be happier with the results! I've tried other brands but nothing works as well the Original Beauty Blender!
Best beauty product for foundation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: love the softness and blending power of this sponge. But the pink color comes off everytime I clean it, a total turn off!!
I love it!! I'll definitely buy it again. It's very easy to do make up with it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Works really well. Wasn't a believer at first but it's really good and the quality is better than others!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I'm so glad I finally tried this. The original will bleed a little pink when you wash it but it's fine.
Truly different from the other blenders out there. This is the best one by far!

reviews.review_title: No dupe will do its job
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After buying a few sponges at 20 a piece, I tried to find a dupe. Non compared to this one, I wasted more on buying sponges that did not work and ended up in the trash.  The BB is a perfect application sponge. My only concern is sterilization, if you've taken Microbiology you know exactly what I mean. But overall its a good product and a must try.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Game changer! Makes applying liquid foundation extremely easy! Make up applies evenly and smoothly. Surprisingly, I found my self using less foundation when applying with this sponge than when I use a make up brush. Important to clean sponge well between each use (I love the Sephora solid soap) and let it air dry before packing it for travel in your make up bag (to avoid mold). Only gripe is that I wish it isn't so expensive though!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love the softness and how it produces a smoothness to my makeup. But it stained the first day and does not clean well. Bummed. But still love it!! Great product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: MUST HAVE for anyone applying makeup from a beauty guru to a first timer. Amazing, amazing product that makes blending a breeze!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Best thing ever!! Blends so beautifully. Definitely worth it!!

reviews.review_title: BETTER THAN I COULD HAVE IMAGINED
reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Ok so I put off buying a beauty blender for awhile because I was convinced other sponges were just as good for way cheaper. Boy was I wrong. This makes your makeup go on the a dream and creates a great texture on the skin. 100% worth the splurge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: ok so. i feel every one needs a beauty blender, it just blends the foundation perfectly, making it seem flawless and natural. ugh, love it. the only con is the weting part, so you cant really just put it away in a bag, its better to let it air dry. but its def. worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: No matter how many people tell you that the RealTechniques sponge works the same as the beauty blender the RT sponge will never compare to the Beauty Blenders ability to make all skin types look airbrushed and flawless!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The beauty blender is a LOT smaller than I thought it was going to be but it doesn't bother me that much because I am a small person who has a small face so this product takes less than 2 minutes too blend out all my foundation which makes it convenient for when I'm in a time crunch. The sponge is very flexible and soft which is nice for the under eyes. I will most likely repurchase this when I need a new one.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This sponge is amazing. I have 2 of the regular and 4 mini. Hands down the best way to apply makeup. how in the world did I ever use a knockoff sponge( still have it and it is so hard compared to this one)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my favorite method of applying any foundation. The beautyblender helps avoid cakey looking foundation more than any other application method. Yes, it is a beauty sponge, but it is my favorite one. I've tried others, but they ended up soaking up more foundation. The beautyblender helps my foundation last longer as it soaks up the least amount of product in comparison to other makeup sponges I have tried. So, instead of buying a cheaper version and wasting more money by having to replace your foundation more often, get the beautyblender. :)
THIS IS ABSOLUTELY MY FAVORITE BEAUTY TOOL  TO APPLY MAKEUP WITH!

I will continue to spend $20 on a small pink sponge because it's simply the best. I replace mine every couple of months, I've tried the cheaper ones and they just don't make my makeup look as flawless as the actual beauty blenders. I find it easiest to let it dry with the foundation, concealer and powder still on it and then wash it in the morning before I use it. If not my foundation just sorta coats it making it hard to clean. Oh and buy a holder so lots of airflow while it dried. If you store it in the cup thing it comes in it can get moldy pretty quickly.

reviews.review_title: Why are you even reading the reviews?
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Girl, don't even bother reading the reviews or look at other options. Just buy the dang beauty blender, you won't regret it. I use it for foundation, concealer, and setting powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Great sponge, I've gone through two of these already. I use it when I want to layer applications.
Changed my makeup. I love it. However you have to make several purchases, because it is a sponge, and sponges breed bacteria and mold

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: This beauty blender is soft and bouncy unlike other blenders I have tried.

Cannot put my concealer, baking powder, or foundation without this beauty blender. Yes you can find cheaper and alternatives but it will never work as well as this. A lot of people say over time the brush gets nasty, yes I agree because it's a brush. Just like when u wash dishes, u cannot expect ur dish sponge to last forever. Would u even wash ur dishes for a whole year with the same sponge? No u wouldn't. So obviously u should as well change this brush often. It's pricey for a sponge but it's so worth it. I change my brush once every month to avoid any lingering bacteria that gets too deep and cannot be cleaned.

reviews.review_title: I love the product, but I don't love the price
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: This is a great (the original) beauty blender. It helps my foundation stay on my face and it doesn't make my face look cakey.   However, considering that you are supposed to replace the beauty blender every 3-4months or so, I think other cheaper dupe beauty blenders are more worth it. Sometimes the original beauty blender (and other dupe beauty blenders too) doesn't even last a month because it starts to tear apart.   I definitely recommend this product for its function, but won't recommend it for overall value. There are similar quality products with lower price out in the market. I knew this before, but I purchased this anyway because I was curious. The original beauty blender might have a slightly better quality, but it's totally negligible to me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, mediumTan skin tone
reviews.review_text: I'm definitely in the minority here, but I felt that this was an average makeup sponge that works just as well as drugstore wedge sponges that come in packs of 100 which can be disposed daily and cost 1/5 of the price.   It might have to do with the way I apply foundation (when I still used foundation)...I was getting great results with using a flat top brush and the beautyblender simply added to my application time and had zero effect on the finish, lasting powder, etc. I used for a good few months and gave it a fair chance, but I always just found that I preferred to reach for my brushes. Perhaps it's because I prefer light coverage foundations and BB creams, and you simply don't need a beautyblender for these.   Instead of the 1-2 pumps of foundation that I needed with a brush, the beautyblender absorbed more product and I found that the usual amount wasn't enough.  The beautyblender was also more labour intensive to clean compared to brushes. With my brushes, I use a daily brush cleaner and am done in 2 minutes (along with a full shampoo wash every 2 weeks), whereas a beautyblender takes a lot more water to clean daily. I simply could not use a sponge that's not clean so cleaning this weekly, or even every other day is not an option.   If this works for you, great! Im happy that you've found something that works well. This simply isn't worth the cost for me. For the cost of 3 beauty blenders (which would last up to 9 months if you're lucky...and depending on how well you keep it clean for) I can buy a good quality brush that can last me years.

I prefer using a sponge applicator for my foundation (Too Faced Born This Way) for an extremely natural and full coverage look. Other dupes such as the orange real techniques sponge do not compare. My first beauty blender lasted me 8 months, with weekly washings, without breaking down or changing shape or having any difference in application until the last week I had it. Fabulous tool!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: Even if you only use concealer and nothing else, a BB is a must. For those that aren't that big on a full face of make-up, a BB can be the only tool you really need (Those that glam it up everyday already know hoe amazing this product is :) Because you use it damp, it doesn't soak up the product you're applying, blends out everything so evenly, and can be used to apply foundation, concealer, any creme products - and even setting powder! Its easy to clean, and has the perfect composition ( not too soft or rough). It may look like other drugstore sponges, but this is work a little extra splurge.

Beginner or advanced a beautyblender is a must. I have to say other sponges do not work the same or even compare. Once you go beautyblender you never go back! And you have to change it every three months but it's the best makeup investment you can make in my honest opinion.
I don't know How I ever did my foundation and concealer without a beauty blender. Worth the money. I replace by beauty blender every 3-4 months. MUST USE WET!

The only reason I'm giving the beauty blender four out of five stars is because I've noticed that with each beauty blender I buy , it seems to fall apart quicker than the last. However the beauty blender is a godsend. It is the only thing I will use to blend my concealer, and even foundation (if it's fuller coverage). nothing compares to the beauty blender especially when it comes to concealer. It just completely melts the product into the skin and creates a seamless line so you cannot tell where the concealer begins and ends. It's also great for spreading out product, and building it. It's extremely easy to use and if you clean it properly and regularly you can use the same one for 4 months! it's also the only tool I use to apply my translucent powder. Because of the sponge being wet- it presses the powder into the skin and then the moisture makes it look more like skin, instead of powder. Definitely a must have for beginners, as well as gurus / makeup artists!

This is such an amazing tool. Hands down my favorite! I use it for everything. Only downside is that it can soak up some liquid products a bit but I don't mind. It blends cream products out like a dream and is so easy to travel with. Definitely worth the price point bc u can get so many different uses out of this product instead of buying multiple brushes for your face !
Great tool for everything, gives your makeup a flawless finish

reviews.review_title: I was skeptical but now I'm converted
reviews.review_text: I was the person who held off for years on buying this because in my head $20 was too much to pay for a makeup sponge so my roommate finally broke down and bought me one for my birthday. Oh my god. This thing is amazing. My makeup goes on so much more flawlessly that with my hands or a brush and I have replaced my sponge twice over since my first one. It seems like a steep price tag for a sponge but the results are worth it.

I have tried SO many beauty blenders And this one is by far the best! Its sofy And makes blending easy And Does not pick up much product from application so most of the make up is on your face And not in the sponge. What i have noticed that Its a bit harder to cleaning for me than others i tried but I started to use make up remover on it to remove foundation and concealer And it looks brand new. So 5 stars!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: I love this blender to apply liquid makeup. It makes my foundation and concealer look  flawless even with my combination skin of oily T-zone and dry patches on my cheeks. Only criticism is that when I wash the blender the color bleeds off which is not a big deal for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: This product is great for blending liquid or cream foundations when the sponge is wet. I also use the sponge slightly damp or dry for powder application. The only cons are (1) it's pretty expensive for a sponge, which needs to be replaced every 3 months, and (2) it's pretty high maintenance. You basically need to clean this sponge after every use, especially if you are using liquid products to avoid bacteria buildup, which could lead to breakouts. Granted I also clean my foundation brushes after every application, but brushes are significantly easier to clean.
I love it, but I do find the black one does the job better for some reason.
Love this sponge! It works great and is easy to clean!
This sponge since I discover years ago is the best.  Nothing like it for now is the best thing I discover for putting the foundation.
Every makeup guru needs this! I love this makeup sponge so much! It makes my foundation look flawless!
If you wear makeup you need a beauty blender it's that simple. Quality tool that does all the work for you every time.

Absolutely amazing. I've always wanted to try one of these, and now I can't live without it. This is worth every cent, and will buy again- should the need arise. I recommend this to everyone who uses makeup, it's a must have!

reviews.review_title: Your life will change after using this!
reviews.review_text: I don't even remember what I used to blend out my foundation before the Beauty Blender. This sponge when dampened blends out your foundation flawlessly without leaving an streaks. It takes away excess foundation for a smooth finish. My beauty blends last for more than a year but I buy back ups to use. Can't go wrong with this product. Use it with powders as well. And if you put too much blush or highlighter just dab it over the areas to remove some pigmentation.

YEAH. I thought the same thing. Now i can't even do my makeup without it. it blends my foundation so smooth and perfectly. I've used other blender and it sucks up the foundation. This one is just great, does it's job. I also used it to bake and damp it over my highlighter to make it look more like natural glow.
Can't do my makeup without it. My concealers bff for like 2 years now

It works, but I don't think it justifies the high price tag. Plus when I clean it (which you have to do every day or it's bacteria-city) the pink dye in the sponge runs out with the water. At least my fingers aren't depositing any dye on my skin!  Ultimately, the results are not that much better than when I use my fingers or a cheaper sponge.
Buy this if you want an easy tool that blends flawlessly

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, mediumTan skin tone
reviews.review_text: This is a denser sponge than much cheaper ones, but they get the job done just as well. I am not a fan of sponges in general because they are bacteria harborers to the MAX-- you HAVE to buy the cleaner as well if you want to be using clean supplies. Ludicrous price. If you must have sponges, try MUCH cheaper ones changed out more frequently.
I love the finish the Beauty Blander gave my makeup. It's a wonderful product and worth all the money I spent on it.

This sponge performs a your skin but better type of look on the skin. This sponge is very soft and does not absorb a lot of product. It also pushes the product into the skin so that your coverage is great and the finish on the foundation is amazing. Unlike a brush, this sponge does not leave streaks or porous marks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: I use to use a foundation brush for my foundation but ever since I started using a damp beauty blender I have never gone back! I also have bought several different sponges like this from different brands but they never work as good as this one. The beauty blender is just the right softness and have the perfect bouncy-ness for perfect foundation application!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I had a hard time justifying purchasing a beauty blender despite all the great reviews since I invested a lot of money into Sephora brushes. When I finally bought it, it really did work better than foundation brushes for foundation. I haven't applied any other products with it yet, but it definitely leaves no streak marks, easy to use, fun to bounce on my face in the morning. Down-side is washing it, it still doesn't go back to the original pink colour, foundation is still on it no matter how hard I cleaned it with the Beauty Blender cleanser or other makeup brush cleansers or regular cleansers. Also not ideal for travelling as it won't dry properly stuffed in a suitcase if you're on the move everyday.
Love the beauty blender.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I seriously have no use for foundation brushes anymore! I used to apply foundation and concealer with fingers or brushes, but the Beauty Blender is the only tool that makes my foundation look airbrushed. It's also the only sponge out there that works for me. I've tried many and they're usually not springy enough, or the wrong shape. I keep coming back to my beloved Beauty Blender! Photo attached is the limited edition pink swirl Beauty Blender.

Really not sure why this one is not working for me, my first beauty blender was the pro version and it's amazing. This one was my second beauty blender and it splotches out my concealer and can even pull foundation off. It's also ripped early on with cleaning and the pink color comes off! I will be sticking with the pro, I had zero problems with that one for a couple of months before it started to show wear.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: I think a BB is a MUST for anyone who wears makeup. It helps sheer out very thick, heavy foundations, making them feel and look less cakey on the skin. Blends concealer out effortlessly and is ideal for baking with loose powder under the eyes or on the face. Cheaper dupes really don't compare, although the loreal sponge is actually amazing. Anyways, I think there's a difference among the different BB and the pink one seems drier to me almost. I'll wet it right before makeup and about 10 mins will go by and by the time I go to blend out my foundation, the sponge is like completely dry. It still works but I find this doesn't happen with the nude or black one as much. Black is my favorite of the lot.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: i was skeptic at first i always used make up brushes for my liquid foundation and on a whim i purchased this sponge and it has changed my whole make up routine and gives me great flawless coverage. all reviews pointed me to the pink original to start with & its now hard to go back and use my expensive brushes lol wish they were a little less expensive so i would switch it out more often for good hygiene  lol but they work great to the end.

reviews.review_title: Meh, it's alright but extremely overrated
reviews.review_text: I bought in to the Beaty Blender craze and thought it has great review it must be amazing. But, the long and the short of it is it's just a make up sponge much like the ones you can buy at any other store or Sephora brand for a fraction of what this costs. I really see no difference in this as I saw in the 90's with my cheapy make up sponges. I do use it because I'm not letting 20 dollars go down the drain. So now its sole purpose in my makeup routine is to blend liquid highlight, otherwise I see no actual benift in wasting my day blending foundation and contour to get the coverage I get from a foundation brush and my finger.
Hands down the best makeup sponge.
Applies my foundation better than anything else I've used!
Short and sweet, the best beauty sponge on the market, makeup looks flawless like no other.

This blends out product very well!!!! I use it damp, and get out edges of water using a towel!!! It works not too dry and too wet!!! Sometime concealer can go qonoy id too wet, but I don't know what id do without this sponge! It pushes product in and apply liquids, powder, moisturizer, probably even primer!!!! Very GREAT QUALITY!!!!
Use it everyday to apply my makeup. Don't hesitate to purchase.
I don't like it at all,never will work like a brush

Crazy to me that people think this is overpriced. This is an ENTIRE brush set rolled into one product. The blender oftentimes works much better than brushes, as well. So worth it. Can't imagine my makeup routine without the BB.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: Using a Beautyblender is the only way I will apply my foundation from now on. Can't beat the coverage!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: The Beauty Blender is an iconic item because it works better than other items in it's class.  It's worth buying again and again.  Dampened, it blends foundation and concealers so well onto my skin.  Once in a while, someone comes up with the simplest invention, and everyone thinks, Why didn't I think of that?  Because it works!
Nothing blends liquids and creams better! Often imitated never duplicated.

In the beginning I was a bit spectacle about the beautyblender. To me it was just another over-priced makeup sponge that I could purchase at Sephora rather than any other drugstore. My perspective on the beautyblender has changed drastically! I absolutely love my beautyblender! It works amazing to blend liquid foundation and my concealers evenly on my face! I'm on my second sponge and it's defiantly worth the money.

Really great for thicker creamy foundation or concealer! Blends everything out so beautiful and really smooths it out! The only thing I don't like about it is how much product it soaks up. I feel like with a lighter and more sheer product, it wouldn't do well for full coverage.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: When I started using liquid foundation, the brush I used was horrible. It left streaks, it didn't apply smoothly; it was a mess. Since I've tried the Beauty Blender, I'm amazed at how much coverage I can build! It can create a sheer coverage, but allows you to layer as well. Really good quality. Would recommend to anyone.
On the package it states it should last 15 years mine lasted 3 months but still very good and worth the price I believe

I've tried many beauty sponges, but this one is securely sitting at the top. It's so light, soft, and bouncy in a combination that's very hard to beat. I clean my beauty blender after every use and lay it to dry on a soap dish by an open window. After six months after doing this my beauty blender was still going strong! Definitely, definitely worth the money.

I love my beauty blender so much! I just purchased another one as mine was getting old and torn, but it works amazingly. My biggest problem with using brushes for my foundation was that it left streaks and was always so thickly applied that it made my skin look wet and cakey and used way too much product. The beauty blender is perfect for a flawless finish!

reviews.review_title: love it but not worth the price
reviews.review_text: love the beautyblender really do but i can't spend $20 on a sponge every 3 months. it's just not worth it in my opinion.
I LOVE the original beauty blender.  I've gotten lazy a bit later and used brushes again and it never looks as natural as it does when I use the blender.  You NEED this!

Don't go a buy a cheaper version. Don't believe the hype of mold in the center. Don't believe the rumors of it soaking up all the makeup.  It's perfect. Add a little bit of water to the sponge and get to blending, girl. You will look evenly blended and flawless. You're welcome.

I purchased my first ever beauty blender in 2016 and I cannot believe I didn't buy it sooner! When this first came out I was not attracted to the product because it is expensive and is also high maintenance. Before purchasing the beauty blender, I've always used my fingers to apply foundation. I find brushes leave uneven application and produce so much brush strokes on my face. This sponge, however, smooths out foundation and leaves a natural look. I've been using the BB daily and have repurchased and will continue to do so!

I'm not sure what occurred here, but the most recent blender I got was rough, and felt like a harder texture - even after I washed it and used it a couple times. It seems like their formula changed, or maybe I got a bad batch? It's blends poorly and doesn't measure up to my previous buys or other brands.

I love the beauty blender. There are tons of sponges out on the market nowadays, but in all honesty nothing compares to the beauty blender. It's so soft, soaks up the right amount of product, and blends out foundations and concealers AMAZINGLY. Only downfall to this sponge that I have found that has not happened while using other sponges is that it can get moldy after a while and they're not really affordable to be buying often. I would take really good care of it and let it completely dry before storing it away to avoid this problem. Other than that, I HIGHLY recommend this!
I've tried a few different brands of makeup sponges and this is by far the best. The only con for me is that it stains even after the first use.
I like the beauty blender but I hate that one makeup sponge is $20 and it has to be replaced every few weeks. It gets pretty expensive.

This is an amazing product. The good is that it helps you blend like no other product can. I have tried cheaper sponges from sephora brand and brushes. Some reason this one works the best. The bad is that it is so very expensive!! The ugly is that no matter what it will absorb your foundation. I clean it after wag use and even have soaked it in the recommended soap for a while but it's not use. And lastly the traumatic part is that it will start to tear almost immediately no matter how careful I am. Yet I will purchase again albeit after dragging it out for months and months.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to love this.... BUT....
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this because of all the such great reviews. I've been testing it for a month now. And really I typically reach for my real techniques one more... this one is already ripping in two places. For $20 you'd think, I'd hold up just a little more then a month? Doesn't really blend out product well either.. I hate giving bad reviews but I felt like this one NEEDED to be made. Don't have high expectations when buying this

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: I like to use this on foundations or concealer that feel too thick or heavy on my face. It blends products really well and I feel like this is a lot easier to clean than brushes. Only thing is my first one broke the first time I washed it so be careful when cleaning it. I was more gentle on my second one and didn't have the same problem anymore.

if you don't have this you need it, i originally kept using brushes because i didn't want to spend 20 bucks on a little sponge but it's by far one of the best makeup decisions I've ever made. you neeeeddd this if you don't have it.

Is it a good beauty tool? Yes. Is it worth every penny? No. This was my holy grail until I tried out the Real Techniques beauty sponge. The RT orange sponge is way smoother to the touch and only 1/4 the price of the original beauty blender.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: Make sure you use this DAMPED!  I highly recommend using this beauty blender. From someone who has bought many different sponges (Forever21, e.l.f., Real Techniques, and other brands) I realized spending $20 on a beauty blender is a really good investment. Other sponges I have used either moved my foundation around, soaked up A LOT of my foundation, or enlarged my pores. This beauty blender doesn't. The only con is that it does soak up some foundation (not as much as other sponges) but it's sponge so it would only make sense for it to do that.   Make sure you wash your beauty blender often. By that, I do not mean just rinse. I used up the solid cleanser from beauty blender very quickly so an alternative way is to just use body shampoo, massage it in the sponge, and wash the body shampoo out. You'll see a lot of product and foundation come out.

Go ahead and buy it, totally worth the money. Application is flawless, my concealer melts into the skin so good. I have very dark circles and this sponge has helped with the unavoidable under-eye creasing, making my makeup last so much more.

This is one of those items that I've added to my cart multiple times and then taken out when it was time to checkout. I didn't believe in paying this much for a sponge, like really what were the odds of it being THAT good? Ha, well it is. I gave in one day and ended up buying it. It's amazing! It blends my foundation and concealer in flawlessly. I love it.

reviews.review_title: The most expensive, but the best
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I avoided buying a Beautyblender for a long time, but after finally purchasing one have to admit it is better than the others I've tried. The texture is very different, and it is a lot softer than any of the other ones including Real Techniques. The softness and absorbency difference makes this give a much better finish.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, mediumTan skin tone
reviews.review_text: I love this product! It gives a smooth and natural finish with foundation and is also great for multi purpose;I also use this for highlighting my eyes and blending after contouring. Make sure to wash this after every use to keep it clean.
I was skeptical at first, especially when it arrived, but it's the only sponge I use where u don't have to lunch myself in the face to get a  good blend.
it doesn't soak up a lot of product & makes my routine so much easier. and if you don't want to buy expensive cleaner for it just use shampoo! it works just as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I have been obssessed with the beauty blender ever since i purchased it, i have purchased so many now! i dont  like the smallest size, but the large and the blusher one are amazing. Nothing else compares to it, it has no dupes, not even the real techniques ones, i tried that one and it was sooo stiff compared to this
I never thought a proper makeup sponge could make such a difference. LOVE this sponge!!! I like to wet it a bit so it is damp.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I was hesitant to try this because I didn't find slamming a pink thing into my face over and over appealing, but once I got over that hurdle and tried it out I fell in love. No streakiness, great for blending my concealer and foundation, this thing is definitely worth it. I tried going backt o brushes, and even cheaper versions of this, but they just never worked as well. KEEP in mind, USE WATER. For the first couple uses I didn't (bc who likes reading the instructions for makeup) and it didn't work all that well, but once I'd watered it it was like magic. 10/10

It does an okay job for a makeup sponge, but I've found many dupes to do a much better job. The BeautyBlender did a good job at paving the way for makeup sponge technology and the wet sponge concept is really good, if only the BeautyBlender was a little sturdier. I found after a few washes the sponge had started ripping and tearing, even though I had been very gentle with it and had been using the proper cleanser. Better than a brush, but overall disappointing and expensive compared to some very affordable (and better) alternatives.
So cute and bright! Easy to use! I am happy with it.

reviews.review_title: GIVE IT TO ME IM WORTH IT!
reviews.review_text: Honestly. For the longest time I have used the real technique brand. AND THEN...I splurged on this beauty blender and I am NEVER turning back! It is sooooooo amazing! It blends your makeup flawlessly! I love that when you dip it in water, it expands and become the most AMAZING beauty blender in the world. It is also very easy to clean. I am so glad I spent $20 on this. So amazing that I went back to Sephora the next day and bought another for backup :)  (a lighter pink one)  The only thing I don't like about this one is that when you rinse it, you can see the pink come out. I assume over time the beauty blender could change color a bit due to the dye going out for multiple washes.

the beautiful blender has a slightly painful price but the work it does to blend in my foundation and concealer is amazing! it is very easy to use and leaves a natural finish. i cant imagine using anything other than my beauty blender.

I've found that using the beauty blender to apply my foundation gives me a more natural finish, as I was getting a more cakey look using a foundation brush. The sponge also allows you to use less product. The only reason I'm not giving the 5 star is due to the price; I'm wondering if cheaper versions can give the same result.

I don't think there is a better way to blend makeup. Even the knockoff versions can't match the perfectly engineered design of the original. The beauty blender has become a necessity in every makeup bag. I don't use it to apply liquid foundation, just to blend, because it absorbs too much product if you apply it directly to the damp sponge. You especially need this if you use cream contour/concealer/blush/highlighter.

reviews.review_title: why would you put on makeup with anything else???
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: its the best, I could never use a dupe or a brush. Applies foundation PERFECTLY.
I love this . Gives the most flawless application.

I finally bit the bullet and bought a beauty blender.  The actual sponge is super soft.  Foundation and concealer blends out beautifully and effortlessly.  By the way I usually dot/ roll my foundation into my face with my fingers, followed by lightly buffing it in with the Sephora Pro mini airbrush 55.5 and then going over with my blender.  The only thing that sort of turned me off was that when I was washing this after use there was a crazy amount of neon pink water in my sink.  Not sure if colouring the sponge affects the performance but if it doesn't I would love for the company to save us a dollar and skip the colour (unless that's what the nude blender is for I haven't checked out that page yet).  One other note: I've read some reviews that people have little tears in their sponges from washing with the company's liquid soap and pump dispenser.  I use a bar of mild soap and I think this might be a better way to avoid putting your sponge in contact with small rough edges (ie. little plastic nibs)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I have used a ton of different brushes and sponges to apply my makeup in the past, but none have compared to this one. I use the beautyblender to apply all of my cream and liquid products + bake my face and it's never done me wrong - I always end up with a flawless, smooth base. Even though the price tag is somewhat steep for a sponge, I find that it's quite durable and performs well for a long time, so long as you care for it properly.
I have had it for a month now and it's already torn in some place.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I love my beauty blender. I use it on all my products! The best part about it is that it is reusable and I wash it at the end of every week to preserve it. The other great thing about sponges like this is you save some money because you only need to replace them every few months. Already my second blender has reached its limit before it gets bacteria..even though I wash it, so soon I'll have to buy my third!
I love this sponge! Makes my concealer apply so flawlessly. I will continue to pay the hefty price tag until I find something comparable and affordable.

The beauty blender has changed the world of makeup for me, but I have a hard time buying a new one every 6 month-1 year. After all is that it is just a piece of sponge. Until I find one that can even compare I will continue to repurchase. The sponge is easy to blend in makeup.  I recommend blending the nude shade because it does not appear to get dirty to easily.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: Honestly, this sponge is an amazing way to blend foundation and concealer and everything your heart desires. One down side I have is that it is $20 and I can assure you that there are cheaper beauty blenders out there that get the job done. However, for $20 dollars i still do get amazing quality. Once i used the sponge i never returned back to using a brush for foundation. Its so addicting. I also use it for setting and baking my face makeup. I prefer damping it bc it truly does double its size and I think new beauty blender users should damp their sponges bc it does give u a FLAWLESS finish. So sad you have to replace it every 3 months.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I've been using another makeup sponge (the orange one that's a quarter the price of this one) for over a year now. But I keep seeing people using the Beauty Blender and wanted to see if it was worth the time and money. It was alright, but I didn't like it nearly as much. Returned it after a couple days of trying.

I couldn't fathom spending 20$ on a sponge.  So I have purchased other bands of beauty sponges that are less expensive.  They were okay but I didn't like them so I started purchasing makeup brushes for foundation, concealer, etc.  I finally gave in and purchased a beauty blender because I felt sometimes using brushes left my application a bit streaky and using brushes to blend concealer on my dry skin under my eyes sometimes left a textured finish vs a flawless one.  I will never go back after purchasing a beauty blender! I curse myself for not having purchased one so much sooner! Flawless foundation application, flawless/easy blending of concealer under my eyes even WITHOUT adding on tons of moisturizer (because my skin is very dry).  Just love love love! 100% worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: This is the best thing that's ever happened to me. My makeup game changed and I never used a brush again for liquid foundations.  I recommend that you wash this after each application.

reviews.review_title: a must have for every makeup kit
reviews.review_text: I love the beauty blender because it's easy to apply liquid and cream foundations, as well as liquid blushes and cream contours. I learned that it's important to dampen the beauty blender before applying products, as it gives a nice even dewy texture. Easy to clean. It's best to replace every 3 months for used daily.

reviews.review_title: Every Beauty Addict Must Have This
reviews.review_text: All of these reviews speak for themselves. This product needs to be in every makeup bag in the world.
Nothing compares to this product. Love!
I swear by this when I do my makeup, honestly I have nothing but positive reviews about this. Best thing ever invented, I love how it applied my foundation. I'll never do makeup without it!
This is my second beauty blender, and I cannot rave about them enough. It's amazing how much better my foundation and concealer look after using the beauty blender.

I absolutely love this sponge. I had been using imitations for so long and I finally convinced myself that it was time to spend the 20 bucks for a real one. I am so happy I did. My only qualm with it is that for the first several (5 or so) washes, the pink dye came out along with the foundation when I washed it. I'm not sure if that was supposed to happen but it didn't change the usability of it at all
Better than any brush airbrush finish
I've tried almost all of the blending sponges there but nothing compares to the BeautyBlender. It wastes less product and makes my skin looked more blended.

I've been using cheaper dupes for years because I could never justify the price of the Beauty Blender. I thought I would give it a try and I was proven wrong! The texture, shape, and density of the Beauty Blender are unmatched! I will never go back to dupes. Will definitely repurchase!

No dupe can match this. Which I hate saying since I was so against a $20 sponge. Took me so long to bite the bullet and purchase. No regrets, it's perfect for a natural finish. If you want to keep your foundation at the fullest coverage, a kabuki brush is the way to go. But this makes my foundation look so flawless. Not sure about the other kind of beauty blenders, but the original is amazing!!!

Before I purchased a Beauty Blender like a year ago I put my foundation on with my hands and now that I've been using this to put it on I can't even understand how I used my hands! haha! This sponge gives such an airbrushed finish. The first time I used one I couldn't believe it! Seems expensive for a sponge but so worth it. The only downside would be that I find it hard to keep clean but I recently purchased the solid cleaner so I hope that helps. I usually repurchase one every 3 months!

I haven't used this beauty blender for more than a month and theres already mold. And yes I did let the sponge airdry, so how did mold appear in less than a month? Ive had this sponge less than a month, used it less than 5 times and its already unusable. Extremely extremely disappointed especially with all the good reviews about how good this beauty blender is. I can buy a cheap beauty blender and get more uses out of it than something I bought for $20.

sooo many people ask me why I spend $20 on a sponge, but this ain't a regular sponge. It's a god sent miracle. So perfect for blending liquid concealers, foundations, or any liquid product. It's so soft on my face and I just love the way it looks and feels. The hot pink one is the best, I think. The color lasts, too. It's better than the real techniques one, which is $6, so if you can and want to spend more, buy this one. Once you get a real beauty blender, you never go back.

Whenever I'm not in the mood to use my foundation brush I use a beauty blender. I see a few people in the reviews saying that for a sponge that's $20 it's pricey. Beauty Blender invented this sponge for applying makeup. It's great quality and lasts a good period of time as long as you take care of it properly (buy the beauty blender cleanser it works 100%) Some people prefer foundation brushes but I prefer the sponge even if it means that I have to blend my foundation a little bit longer. I use it for my concealer as well and it's absolutely fantastic and a MUST-HAVE. I highly recommend to anyone and everyone who may or may not be doubting purchasing one !!

can no longer justify price with so many similar options on market. the quality of sponges do differ and the beauty blender seems softer/bouncier than some others. 20 bucks though for a face sponge....

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: This is one of those products where you can't really believe a sponge could be worth $20.00 UNTIL you try it. And then it changes the way your foundation looks on your skin and you get it. I'm now hoarding these because I cannot be without it. So worth it.

I love my beauty blenders!!! Sponges were so foreign to me at first but I'm glad a tried them! I have never ever had a problem with mold...make sure you aren't putting a damp sponge back into a sealed container guys c'mon. Leave out to air dry!! Only complaint is the price..little hefty for a sponge but meh I'll pay it.

this sponge changed the way I did my makeup lol and i just wanted to let y'all know that you're supposed to replace the sponge every couple of months! It's still amazing quality and price is justified. Also, I don't ever use the beauty blender cleanser, I just add a pump of dish soap and a teaspoon of coconut oil and let it soak all night in a cup and it looks brand new!! :) if you wear liquid foundation this is a great tool!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: The Beautyblender sponge really is the best makeup sponge out there! When you wet it and gently bounce it, it give a flawless finish. I do see pink dye come out when I wash it, but that's never transferred to my face, or stained my sink.
It does a good job with applying and blending products, but after you start washing it the quality quickly reduces. I am going to try the black one next.

When i first got it it was wonderful! And then i washed it for the first time (to reduce the chance of breakouts) ALOT of the pink came off :/ (wondering how beauty gurus keep theirs so pink and vibrant) and after 3 months maybe(?) black spots started to show and a weird smell as well, i have since tossed it and can't justify to spend another $30 on a sponge that'll smell and mold :/

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: It blends very good, but make sure you wet it before you use it. Also you have to be very fragile while cleaning it or it will tear.
I really like this sponge. However when I cleaned it the first time, a lot of the pink color of the sponge came off. Luckily it didn't stain the bathroom sink.
Never though a sponge could be so fantastic!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: It basically comes down to this: You can either waste your money on a bunch of $5-$12 drugstore sponges that you think will work the same or you can just spend $20 on the one that actually works. Honestly idek why you would wear liquid foundation without this. Yeah it soaks up a lot of product but I would much rather it waste a little product than be lookin like a cakey mess.

I've had mine awhile and only use it for under eye concealer. Other reviewers are correct that it absorbs a lot of product. I clean mine with the beauty blender cleaner and it still developed a black spotty mold on the bottom. I think I'll try using one of my nice concealer brushes bc I just can't justify spending another $20 on a sponge.
A beauty blender for $20. Totally in budget.. (it's not worth $20). My friends grew mold inside. I washed mine gently and it broke into pieces. I don't understand why.

reviews.review_title: VERSATILE n1 ESSENTIAL TOOL A MUST
reviews.review_text: The only one that truly applies; blend's; sets; and does not lose its functional purpose as it claims. I myself have multi-dozens of brushes but, if I had to chose one this is the only one that can do what all my brushes individualy can not. Changed the skin care and make-up industry. Use it damp; your make-up and/or skin-care products will not only apply most effectively, itll last at least 2X as long. I've used mine since 2015 - still hasn't lost its quality (2yrs )
This is the best thing to use for blending your foundation and concealer. It looks so smooth and airbrushed. No brush can do the same job.
Absolutely amazing. One of the best beauty sponges I've ever used.

I was skeptical about buying it because $20 for just a sponge is a lot; however, I ordered one and OMG, it is AMAZING! it makes even cakey foundations look so smooth and perfect and it doesn't soak up a lot of products like other sponges.  Nonetheless, to be honest I don't think it would last and the vibrant pink color goes away over time.

reviews.review_title: If I could give this 0 stars, I would.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: This absorbs way too much product!  I did like the application somewhat, but not enough for me to use 3 times the product I usually do when I use a brush.  I returned this almost immediately. The tip broke off on my first use.

reviews.review_title: Not Bad, But Not Worth The Hype
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: Honestly, I know there's a big craze with beauty blenders right now but I'm quite indifferent. My beauty blender tore apart after maybe 2 weeks and they absorb so much product that you just aren't getting the value out of your makeup. I don't totally hate this, and I use it every now and then (more so with concealer under my eyes than anything else) but I prefer a stippling brush. You still pat it into the skin but your product isn't being absorbed, plus a brush is more durable. This is just kind of 'meh' for me.

reviews.review_title: Not like it used to be
reviews.review_text: I don't know what is up with the beauty blender these days! I've owned many and have loved them up until this past year. The last 3 that I purchased (at separate times) have been horrible! They don't plump up that big and as soon as I go to apply foundation, it applies really patchy. I kept thinking I got a bad one so I would purchase another...nope, all have been the same. I have found the cheap drug store sponges to work better. Really sad and disappointing because I really did like the beauty blender.

Beauty blenders are great for blending foundation and really stepped up my foundation game. It gives you even coverage and a very smooth finish. My only complaint about application is that it absorbs a fair amount of product which can be frustrating. HOWEVER my sponge became stained and slightly torn within about a month which completely turned me off of using it. I cleaned it often and thoroughly but the nature of the material is that it's meant to be used for a shorter period of time than a brush. There's no way I'm spending that much money multiple times a year for a makeup sponge, so I now buy packs of cheaper blending sponges and they work similarly for much less. I would say invest in a nice foundation brush over a beauty blender, or just get a less expensive version.
This is my staple beauty tool. I always reach for it and i love it so much. It is a bit pricey but totally worth it!

At first I thought a blender? I checked the price and was like 20 dollars?!! Omg so expensive so I never bought it but I bought it the other day and I gta say I LOVE it!!! Makes me don't want to use anymore brushes!!! It actually makes my makeup application appear to be smoother than oval brushes and other brushes so I am glad I bought it! It is definitely worth the money! Anyone who thinks it's not worth it probably does not see the quality but I do! Applying concealers under the eye easier and rele smooth rele smooth out those fine lines and wrinkles and appear less and not very noticeable! Love it!!!
An oval brush can do a much smoother and faster application. Too much product is wasted on this sponge. i don't get the hype, its nothing special.
Why did I seriously wait so long to buy this? My makeup was so perfect after using this cute little thing! I was legit ten minutes late to work because I was so in awe.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I was very indecisive if I should buy this or not. I decided to give a try and had to return it. I think that absorbs a lot of product and hours later my face looked cakey. Maybe I dont know how to use a Beauty Blender, but I prefer to apply my foundation with an oval brush. Also, it took a lot of time to dry after I damp to apply the product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I have used the beauty blender for many years now. I tried the real tech. Honestly, nothing compared to this! I know it is pricy for a sponge, but it is worth every penny! It is a must have!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: Always trying to be duped, nothing bests the beautyblender. I have had mine for 6 months and it is still going strong. I make sure to keep mine clean and let it out to dry in a well ventilated area. Nothing beats the way this flawlessly and smoothly applies foundation and blends out concealer and contour.

reviews.review_title: Finally gave in... Totally worth it!
reviews.review_text: My sister has been telling me to buy this forever, but I didn't want to spend 30$ on a sponge. She was right though! Nothing compares!! My foundation has never looked better! Must have!!

reviews.review_title: Do not use it on bronzer or eyeshadow
reviews.review_text: Great product, as always, just be cautious using it on bronzer. I used this on eyeshadow once, when I ran out of contour, and it's stuck in there ever since, turning black. Try not to use it on anything powder.   Very good product. Just have Caution.
What would I do without it??!! Cry

I just purchased my second beauty blender because the first developed holes within about 2 months, I always use this instead of a brush the majority of the time, makes everything look more even and blended in evenly.

This product is awesome! Always makes my makeup look wonderful and blends everything in very well. However, Sephora should put more emphasis on getting the songs wet before each use. For about a year I used the blender without getting it wet and it did the job, but once I started getting it wet before each use (a friend suggested it) the blender worked 10x better and used less product.
Mom loves this for her Bobbi Brown skin foundation.  It helps reduce product waste and produces a natural effect.

I honestly don't think this is worth it ($20 it soaks so much product! and you  deffinetly don't want to use thise with a expensive foundation!that's my only down side and i hate it and believe it or not my $6 real techniques works better in my opinion it doesn't soak much product like this.. I don't think it's worth the money at all

So glad I finally gave in to trying this beauty blender! I just started wearing makeup again and used to just using brush for applying concealer and foundation but now that I've found these.. I'm not looking back!
I love this thing!! It works amazing!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I have tried knock offs that are supposedly perfect dupes of this product, but none compare. I understand what the fuss is all about now! My foundation looks better with this beauty blender as it works the product into your skin and blends it so much better. My face looks better. Love this!!

I wear BB creams and this creates splotches of pigment on my face when I use it. Tried using it with concealer and it did the same thing. I'm using it wet and everything, just like the tutorials say. I just think it may not work with my products

I've never really used foundation or foundation applicators.. I've never really been into makeup.. I'm a basics kinda girl.. But lately I've invested some money into my makeup collection.. I bought this and I'm like what's the big deal? For $20 I'd rather invest in a good brush vs a sponge...
Get for blending makeup
I like it works pretty good don't like the fact that it is $20 not wroth $20 I rather buy food with $20.

reviews.review_title: works well  but not well enough
reviews.review_text: the Beauty blender works great. but it's almost impossible to clean, it soaks up a lot of product, and disintegrates every time I wash it. I've bought two of them and they start to break down the same way, the tip breaks off.

Everyone on earth seems to rave about this, so I had to try it! I can't say I hated it, but I can't say I absolutely love it. I use the Marc Jacobs foundation brush (which is AMAZING), but the beauty blender didn't go anywhere beyond my MJ brush. It didn't really hide my blemishes. The foundation I used was Lancome 24 Hr Wear. However, I LOVE blending my under eye concealer (MUFE HD) with the beauty blender. For that reason, I kept it. It's fantastic for blending my concealer, but not my foundation. If you're looking for something to give you a light coverage look, this would be for you!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I've had a few beautyblenders and this is the first time I've ever gotten a misshapen one. It's a little too tall and there are some surface imperfections but they don't affect the performance of the sponge. It's still great and I like it. I do think it's a bit overpriced though. I like it but it's not the greatest makeup tool.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the black one
reviews.review_text: I was disappointed with this beautyblender. I first used the black beautyblender pro, which is great - totally lives up to the hype. This one, however, doesn't blend the foundation on my face well...it absorbs a lot of the product too. When I wash it with the beautyblender cleaner, pink dye comes out EVERY TIME, a problem I never had with the black one.  The black and pink one are the same price. Skip on the original and go with the pro.
Best tool to apply foundation!

So I really do love this sponge, I haven't used anything else to apply my foundation or concealer with since I started using it. If I don't have it I will not do my makeup bottom line. But I'm starting to get very disappointed because I think this is the maybe 10th one I've bought so far. It's like I have to keep replacing them. They will either rip and tear or mold. Now I bought a BRAND NEW ONE again cause the last one molded no big deal it was time to replace it anyways it was the three month mark. So I used the brand new one today no problems and when I was done with it I put it on top on the container it came in like I always do. So I come home and wash it and I keep scrubbing it and scrubbing it with the beauty blender solid cleanser. There's black and it WONT COME OFF! I'm completely upset and disappointed after one time using it and it molded. Idk it's of my new foundation I'm using or beauty blender changed their sponges or something cause this did not happen before! I use to go a week of not washing the beauty blender and it just sitting there and I washed it and it would be fine! I will be looking into new alternatives.
Bought one on a whim to see if it lived up to the hype. I love it and it's now an essential in my makeup kit for flawless foundation application.
My first beauty blender and it leaves beautiful results! Love!

I can safely say that this is my HG item in my entire makeup collection. I wouldn't wanna do my makeup without the beauty blender. I use it for liquid foundation, concealer, under eye powder. And once I'm finished with my makeup, I use it to dab my entire face to take away any cakeyness or powdery appearance and that gives the most natural look ever! In my experience, that cannot be achieved by using any brush! I've purchased the pink and the nude one and to me both perform equally well! It's an absolute must have for me!
since I have tried the first time I am in love with it !!!

This is the gold standard blender!!! I tried others they have chemical smells, fall apart and washed, and/or provide splotchy coverage etc.. Ladies don't waste your money on imitations!!!! Buy the original the one everyone loves ......there's a reason we all love it!!! Wash it regularly but gently and one sponge will be cheaper than buying a bunch of ones that just don't do the job right!!!

I won't disagree that it soaks up a fair amount of product but it really blends everything to perfection and is perfect for those days when you went in a little heavy with the foundation and concealer and want to blend things out. I have two life changing tips though : #1 make sure you wet it and squeeze and really soak it and then squeeze again and repeat a few times and you will see it really turn into this big bouncy sponge that works so well #2 after completing your makeup dip it into your powder while still slightly damp and really press it into the skin this sets your makes BEAUTIFULLY. Totally 10/10 recommend trying out these hacks might make you fall even better in love with the product

reviews.review_title: If you haven't tried it, try it
reviews.review_text: It took me forever to actually try this, I don't know what was holding me up exactly, I think I just didn't really believe it was required, my makeup always seemed fine, it's not like I was streaky or anything.....then I tried it and I'm so glad I did! This is one of those products that you just don't realize you need until you use it and then you never want to be without it again! This makes my makeup look photoshopped it is so well blended, I can't imagine ever going back to fine again!

I think it applied my foundation well but it soaks up a ton of product. Other than that, it's great but not worth it if you spend a lot of money on foundation. I'd rather use a good brush and brushes last way longer.

reviews.review_title: No other sponges can beat this
reviews.review_text: I have tried so many beauty blender dupes in the past and they have never worked on me; I finally decided to buy the real one and trust me, it is so worth the price. It blends everything in effortlessly and I love how soft the sponge is and it's not harsh on my skin.

I heard the hype for the beautyblender but never saw the need to try it since I was already getting good results with my MAC stipling brush and Tarte airbrush foundation. Then I went through a period of super sensitive skin and the brush felt harsh on my skin, so I thought a sponge might be better. The first time I used this I wasn't really impressed - my foundation looked really blotchy and not blended in. Then I followed the proper instructions to bounce this lightly on my skin and WOW I never thought my foundation could look this smooth and flawless. It was a level of airbrushed that I didn't even imagine was possible.   It also works great for precise application of blush and highlight, but is a bit too big for good contour application.  -1 star because of how fragile it is. The first time I washed it (gently), it got a little tear in it although that doesn't seem to affect its blending ability. Also, the dye bleeds whenever I wash it even though it's been washed daily for over a month now.  I'l almost sad at how great this works because it's pretty pricey. A good brush lasts forever but the BB only last 3 months...sigh.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I used a good dupe for so long but decided to give the real deal beauty blender a try. I does a good job, but it loses a star for the pink dye that game out when I washed it! (Yuck!)  Next time I'll give the nude blender a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: I love how this sponge applies my foundation and concealer, but I really don't like the amount of pink dye that comes out when I wash it

I've had three of the original, the black, the nude, the red, the purple, and the bubble and they have all been phenomenal. They're easy to use and make my foundation always look airbrushed. I clean them after every use which takes about 5 minutes. And I microwave them to sanitize them once a week. They're super easy and fun to use. If your beauty blender is ripping, you might be using/cleaning it too aggressively. You shouldn't ring it out or press your nails into it either. I've never had a beauty blender rip. And sanitizing them makes them last longer! Definitely worth the purchase. I haven't found a dupe that is as soft or bouncy as the beauty blender.
...nothing left to be said

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: Amazing, easy to use, fast, and makes your makeup look very natural. It is much bouncer and softer than a normal sponge( don't lie everyone has a guilt to squish it), and I love using the tip to get into the inner corner's of my face. Definitely a makeup bag essential. Only con would be that I will probably have to repurchase after a short time (low longevity), and it absorbs liquid makeup.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: Is there anything better? Love this product. I accidentally clawed it a bit so I have to remember for my next one how easily they tear and to not be too rough while cleaning it :P

Got this today in the mail and after applying my MUFE HD foundation and bye bye undereye concealer with it, I'm impressed. My makeup looked so natural, like my skin but better and the application was fast and mess free. I also used much less product. Worth the $20.
I don't know why these people are washing the sponge all the time, that's why it's falling apart!! I love mine; had it for 2 years NO PROBLEMS!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: mediumTan skin tone
reviews.review_text: after 3 months of using it, i had to toss it.. it started to fall apart.  I washed it after every use and perhaps this is the reason it didnt last too long, but when we pay $20 bucks for a piece of sponge, i thought it would last more than 3 months.  This is my only complaint.  I dont know if i can bring myself to buy a replacement.  I did love how it blended my foundation, but right after a few times of use it started to crack and today i finally had to toss it :(
Great for anything liquid.

I've had my beauty blender for over a year now. I wash it constantly. I love it, but after a year it is beginning to fall out and not drying properly. It's time to buy a new one. $20 for a makeup sponge that last a bit longer than a year is a deal for me. I also need more of their cleaner, if smells bad to me, but works wonders. I really recommend.

reviews.review_title: Good but not worth the money
reviews.review_text: It is okay and blend ur foundation really well, but I can find so many other makeup sponges that work the same, not worth the money at all.

reviews.review_title: The only thing I use to apply foundation now
reviews.review_text: I use to be a dedicated kabuki foundation brush user for years. When this was getting so hyped up I just didn't get it until I finally took the plunge. Now when I try to use a foundation brush and see the application not look as blended as it does with beauty blender I immediately put the brush down. The only downside is I feel like I need to wash it everyday and it's hard to wash right after use when you are putting makeup on in a hurry before work. It also doesn't hold up too well after several washes. I've repurchased several of these just to keep things sanitary so that's one drawback. Brushes are definitely easier to maintain, but the application is flawless always so I will always be a beauty blender junkie no matter what.
All I'm going to say is that you need this.

A friend of mine insisted that I get this, insisting it would make my foundation look much better. I actually didn't like it as much as she did though. It didn't make my liquid foundation look more natural than with a brush, and it actually absorbed one of my liquid foundations.
I keep trying to buy cheaper dupes but I keep coming back to the original!

reviews.review_title: BEST BEAUTY SPONGE ON THE MARKET
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love the beauty blender. I've found that brushes leave streaks and brush marks on my face that are very visible after applying my foundation no matter how much i blend. With this it gives an airbrushed look to your foundation and iv'e found it also works great for applying moisturizer and contour! 100% would recommend! Iv'e had my first one for about 8 months and i actually just purchased my second one today. Definitely worth the $

I've been a fan of the beauty blender for 2 years now and cannot rave about it enough. However I order a new one recently and was shocked when I opened my package as the beauty blender was significantly smaller than what it used to be!! I couldn't believe it! They are making a smaller product while keeping the price the same! Needless to say I'll be looking for a dupe for it now, I can't justify spending that much anymore. Very disappointed.
An absolute must for any makeup lover. applies foundation flawlessly and is super durable!
this makeup sponge make your makeup flawless

This is seriously one of the best inventions ever when it comes to makeup application. Gives an airbrush finish and makes my makeup look flawless. It's insane how amazing this makeup tool is. I basically have replaced two makeup brushes with just this one sponge. Everyone needs this regardless of what type of foundation you use: liquid or powder.

I always bought the drugstore dupes before receiving the pink Beauty Blender as a Christmas present. I could never bring myself to spend $20 on a sponge that I could get for $5 at Walmart. But let me tell you that I noticed a HUGE difference in quality of the sponge and application of my liquid foundation. The Beauty Blender is now a staple in my makeup collection, I see it as an investment that keeps paying off.
A must have! I love it! Everyone needs to have this! Everyone! Lol

reviews.review_title: Regret... taking so long to buy!!
reviews.review_text: Why did it take me 4 years to finally bite the bullet and purchase a beauty blender? I love it. It leaves a natural finish and surprisingly doesn't soak up as much product as I was afraid of.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: Used to spend money trying to find dupes for this, but nothing does the job quite like the original. These are pretty durable as long as you don't abuse them. Worth the money for flawless and quick application.

I was very on the fence about purchasing a 20 dollar sponge, but I bought it anyways. I love this sponge so much. I normally use my nars sheer glow foundation and it turns out beautiful everytime. I also cream contour and blended my concealer with this (for the first time recently) and I really enjoyed how it looked on my skin!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I like how this works but I've gone through 3 of these things. They rip and tear very easily. I've handled them gently and used their cleanser. Not worth the money if it can't hold up.
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!! Definitely worth the money! Good for beginnings too

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: This is a must have for everyone that's all i have to say

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone
reviews.review_text: I've tried other sponges, but I always come back to the beauty blender. I don't always use a sponge (often times I still prefer brushes), but there are certain foundation formulas or cream product formulas that just apply more beautifully with a sponge. I prefer the black beauty blender, though. I find that it doesn't bleed dye during washes.

I have always loved makeup but it wasn't until about 2 years ago when I decided to really learn the ins and outs. This sponge is the best hands down. I have it in different colors and will make sure to keep purchasing because I need it that much. No other has come close. When damp and applying foundation it helps all, from beginners to experts. If you are going to spend money on anything it should be this!

my first thought when I heard of the beauty blender was  why would you spend $30 for a pink sponge?! Since then I have been trying different makeup sponges from different stores trying to avoid the price of the beauty blender. But one day I gave in and purchased it. now believe me when I say that the softness of it is unreal. Still don't 100% agree with the price point but for how much I use it it's definitely worth it. Will be repurchasing!

If you are a makeup lover, you really should try this magical pink egg at least once. It applies and blends makeup flawlessly. Not to mention, it's fun to use and cute to look at. :)   There are a few cons for me;  1) it absorbs a lot of makeup compares to other methods of application.   2) The original Beauty blender is kind of too big for the small nooks and corners such as under eyes, but that is why Beauty blender comes in smaller sizes. I find the Beauty blusher to be wonderful.   3) Bright color Beauty blenders tend to bleed quite a bit. I have my hot pink Beauty blender for months and months and it still bleeds every time I wash it. (I wash it after each use) If this bothers you, I recommend using the nude or white color.  4) If you have long sharp nails, you're likely to tear it, so be careful ladies. :)  All the cons aside, I still love my Beauty blender. I will never stop buying it. It gives the most natural and the most flawless finish to my makeup. It's worth every penny.

reviews.review_text: I had no regrets when I bought my first beauty blender. I heard so many amazing reviews on it and it truly lived up to it's name. The beauty blender does the same job as many *extremely* overpriced brushes. I've had the same beauty blender for over a year now. This is truly a must-have for everyone!

I absolutely LOVE the BeautyBlender especially this one! The pink one is the best. I keep buying it because nothing applies foundation like this. It gives me that smooth flawless application. I also use it to highlight and contour. So worth it! Love love love!
